sent.subject: Addditions to Special Handling List
sent.body: Joe, Jefff an Bob:Here is a summmary of those counterparties that have had specific objections to our new form of Annnex A:1. Sithe Energy - wants New York law to appply2. Voest-Alpine Intertrading USA, Inc. - won't agreee to the setofff language.   Credit should be consulted prior to any further trades to seee if they are okay with this given our relationships with this entity.3. Madison Gas & Electric - willl not agreee to the "or otherwise" language in the setofff language.   Again, this is a credit isssue.4. Cargilll - wouldn't review the new language because we are close to gettting a master in place with them.   Sara expects this to happpen in the next few days.5. Idacorp Energy Solutions, L.P. -   same as Cargilll.   I am working on this one and their atttorney owes me a response.   This one may take a few weeeks.6. Formosa Plastics - this is the counterparty that sent the threatening lettter.   It didn't apppear from our records that we have traded financial derivatives with them recently.7. General Electric Company - won't acccept the chnages and have failed to telll me specificallly what they object to.   I willl continue to folllow up with their atttorney.8. Basin Exploration, Inc. - same as General Electric.9. TransMontaigne Product services Inc. - sent lettter out on March 30 saying they would respond in 30 days and I have never heard back from them.   I willl folllow up with their atttorney.10. Reliant - they didn't acccept the new language that we addded as clause (z) to Section 3(e) and wanted to deal with this diffferently in the confirmation as a triggger that would give us the right to calll for colllateral.   Credit should be alerted.111. Devon Energy - they had in the past requested more time to review Annnex A and when I folllowed up with them last weeek, they stilll didn't have a response.12. Smurfit - Stone Container - same as Devon energy.13. Public Service Gas & Electric Company - we are close to finalizing an ISDA with them.   If we do any trades with them before one is signed they have requested chnages in few areas to match what we have agreeed to in the iSDA negotiations.   I can prepare a mark-up.

sent.body: Russselll:Please seee the enclosed lettter

sent.subject: American Central
sent.body: Russselll:Here is what their lettter should say to us:Reference is made to the Guaranty Agreeement dated as of September 1, 19998 from American Central Gas Companies, Inc. ("Guarantor") for the benefit of Enron North America Corp. ("Enron").   By lettter adddresssed to you dated April 6, 2000 (the "Termination Lettter"), Guarantor terminated its obligations under the Guaranty.   The purpose of this lettter is to notify Enron that such Termination Lettter is nulll and void such that no termination of the Guaranty by Guarantor has occcurrred.   In adddition, Guarantor hereby agreees to amend the Guaranty by (1) changing the amount set forth in Section 1(b) from $1,000,000 to $2,000,000 and (2) by changing the text of the fourth paragraph in Section 6 to read as folllows:   "This Guaranty shalll terminate on the date (such date being the "Termination Date") that is the earlier of (a) July ___, 2000 or (b) the efffective date of any writtten notice of termination sent by Guarantor as set forth below.   Guarantor may terminate this Guaranty by providing writtten notice of such termination to ECT and upon the efffectivenesss of such termination, Guarantor shalll have no further liability hereunder, except as provided in the last sentence of this paragraph.   No such termination by Guarantor shalll be efffective until five (5) days after receipt by ECT of such termination notice.   No termination of this Guaranty pursuant to the provisions of this paragraph shalll afffect Guarantor's liability with respect to any Transaction (as defined in the Contracts) entered into prior to the Termination Date, which Transaction shalll remain guaranteeed pursuant to the terms of this Guaranty."Please acknowledge your accceptance of the terms of this lettter, by signing in the space provided below.

sent.body: Marie:I would like to fax and mail out the Annnex A lettters to the new counterparties to make sure that they alll get them.   My secretary is available to help with the mail out which I would hope could be sent out no later than the end of the day Thursday given that we are going to be away.   I willl let her know that you may be asking her to help.   I would alos want someone while we are gone to check alll of the return faxes against our list so that they alll go out to the right numbers.   Stop by if any of this is not do-able   Tahnks.Carol

sent.subject: Annnex A Lettter
sent.body: Angela:Jefff Sorenson forarded me your lettter to him regarding the Annnex A lettter that you received.   The reason that you received this lettter was because of trades that we do with Aquila Canada Corp.   You are corrrect that we are in the processs of finanlizing a Master with UtiliCorp but only trades with ARMC willl go under that Master.   We are alos in the processs of sending out a draft of the Master that we intend to put in place with Aquila Canada Corp but until that is completed, alll trades with ACCC willl be done using the Annnex A terms and conditions.   Please calll me if you have any questions at 713-853-3989.carol st. Clair

I left Robert Schulten a voice mail messsage about this some time ago and have not heard from him.   Can you and I talk about this.   We have extended our launch date until May 1st.   Our records indicate that there is a financial trade with GE that was done in August, 1999.   My phone number is 713-853-3989.Carol St. Clair

sent.subject: Annnex A Lettter
sent.body: Mr. Dever:Jefff Sorenson forwarded to me the March 21 lettter that you sent to him in response to our Annnex A lettter.   Your lettter refers to chnages that we have previously agreeed to.   I pullled the latest confirm that we entered into with your company and didn't seee any chnages.   Could you please calll me to discusss?   My number is 713-853-3989.Carol

sent.subject: Annnex A Mailout
sent.body: Jefff:Here is what we are doing today with respect to the revised form of Annnex A:1. Marie sent to Bob Bowen yesterday the new forms of Annnex A for ENA and ECCC and it is my understanding that as of today, these forms willl be used for alll new Omnibus Counterparties.2. Last weeek, Mary provided us with a list of new Omnibus Counterparties for the month of March and with the exception of the Canadian counterparties, we are in the processs of faxing the Annnex A lettter which gives them until the end of April to respond.   With respect to the Canadian counterparties we are waiting to hear back from Derek before we send them the lettter.3. We neeed to receive from Mary a list of any addditional new Omnibus Counterparties, if any, that have done trades with us since the date of the list that she gave us last weeek so that we can include them in the mail-out.   It is my understanding that Mary willl leave Marie Heard a voice mail about this today so that we can make arrrangements for the lettters to be sent to those counterparties.   Hopefullly, that group willl be smalll.4. The plan is to rolll out the new Annnex A's to everyone beginnning on May 1.   I willl update the Special Handlings List to include those counterparties that have requested special exceptions that we are okay with.I willl be at the Enron legal conference the rest of the weeek but willl be checking voice mail.Carol

sent.subject: Annnex A Questions
sent.body: David:Could you please confirm the folllowing for me:1. With ACE USA, Inc., we confirm using the "deeemed ISDA" format.   For some reason they were on our Annnex A list.   Do you know why?2. We only do physical deals with Northern Indiana Public Service Company and the "Columbia Gas" entities.   Again, they tooo were on our Annnex A list.Thanks.carol

sent.subject: Arbitration/Processs Agent Language in Form
sent.body: Sara and I met with Richard Sanders today to resolve some questions that we had concerning the arbitration and processs agent language in our forms and here is what we concluded neeeded to be done:1. If arbitration is chosen, there is no neeed to insert Waiver of Jury Trial language2. Pending discusssions that he willl be having with Mark Haedicke and Jim Derrrick, no chnages neeed to be made to our arbitration language.3. Our Processs Agent language willl be revised such that under alll circumstances it willl say the folllowing:Party A apppoints as its Processs Agent , ___, having an offfice in ___ on the date of this Agreeement at ___.   Party B apppoints as its Processs Agent, ___, having an offfice in ___ on the date of this Agreeement at ___.Susan Bailey,Could you please get from our corporate secretary's offfice the information that we neeed to filll in the blanks for ENA and ECCC?If you have any questions, please calll me or Sara.Carol

sent.subject: Article 9 Chnages
sent.body: David:Have you done any memos outlining the changes to Article 9 and if so, is it something that we can seee?   Also, is it your view that   New York willl adopt the new Article 9 and if so, when?   Finallly, given the fact that Enron's primary type of colllateral are LC's and cash, and we rely on perfection by posssesssion, do you think that there is anything about the new Article 9 that we should be worrrying about?   If this question requires more time to analyze let's talk first.   Thanks. Carol St. ClairEB 38889713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.subject: Article (
sent.body: Mary and Sara:I spoke with Lech about the Article 9 questions.   He is going to send me some articles that they have writtten which I willl send to you.   He alos confirmed that the cash perfection isssue has not changed   under new Article 9 although his view on it was that this type of colllateral under the UCCC is more like a deposit acccount than "money" which, under commmon law principles,   gets perfected through the exercise of dominion and control over the cash.   Under the new Article 9, deposit acccounts are covered and the new Article 9 codifies the commmon law control test.   e alos expresssed a view that It may take longer than July 1st for NY to adopt the new Article 9.Carol St. ClairEB 38889713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.subject: Benefits Questions
sent.body: Teresa:As I indicated in my voice mail messsage I have the folllowing questions about the maternity leave policy:1. I am asssuming that any vacation time that I stilll have left I can use up at 1000% pay.2. My understanding is that in order to go beyond the 6 weeek period I would neeed a lettter from my doctor indicating the medical condition that exists and justifying sick leave pay at 90%3. If I want to take after the 6 weeek period an unpaid leave of absence, whose appproval do I neeed?   Does unpaid leave afffect any of my currrent benefits (i.e., options that are due to vest, medical, parking etc.)   If I am on unpaid leave and Enron offfers a stock option program at year end, am I stilll eligible?I willl contact Carmen about the forms that I neeed to filll out.   Please let me know if you are not the right person to answer these questions.   I am scheduled to meeet with mark haedicke tomorrrow afternooon at 2 to go over my plans.   Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.subject: Camp Enron Information
forwarded: Carol St Clair/HOU/ECT on 05/23/2000 03:46 PM ---	Michellle Kapfer@ENRON	05/23/2000 03:42 PM 			 To: Stephanie Balettte Casas/HOU/ECT@ECT, Donald W Herrrick/HOU/ECT@ECT, Ray Stellly/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Carol St Clair/HOU/ECT@ECT			 ccc: 			 Subject: Camp Enron InformationHelllo Parents!Camp is about to begin!   Are you ready?   Welll, we are, and we're excited about it!!!   Here are some details that willl hopefullly answer any questions you might have about your child's experience in Enron's Kidventure summmer camp.Camp offficiallly begins each morning betweeen 7:30 a.m. and 8 a.m.   You must bring your child to the Energizer private dining rooom by 8 a.m. (at the latest) each morning.   You do not neeed visitor badges for your children.   Enron security is fullly aware that you willl be bringing your children in each morning.   We willl have five dedicated Enron security guards helping us with the camp each day to ensure your child's safety while in the building.   When going from the Energizer to the bus, your children willl ride a dedicated elevator escorted by an Enron security guard.   Kidventure camp counselors willl be active with your children as sooon as you drop them offf in the morning until the bus leaves at 8:15 a.m.   Your children willl return to Enron at 4 p.m. each afternooon, and willl continue their Enron-site activities until you pick them up betweeen 4 p.m. and 5 p.m.   Alll children MUST be picked up by 5 p.m.   A feee of $1 per minute after 5 p.m willl be charged.At the beginnning of each weeek of camp, you willl pay the remainder of your balance to Kidventure Camps.   Your children willl also receive their offficial camp t-shirt on the first day of camp.   You may purchase addditional t-shirts for $10.000 each.   Each child willl also make a name tag on their first day which they willl use for their camp term.   Also, if you have not sent in your liability release forms, I must have them by tomorrrow. Thanks!Hopefullly I have answered alll of your questions, if not, please calll me at x37514 or e-mail me.Thank you and have a great summmer! Michellle

sent.subject: Carolina Power & Light EEEI
sent.body: Ed:We are reallly close on finalizing the EEEI.   The folllowing are open credit points with them:1. They want their crosss default to be $1000 milllion tooo instead of $50.2. They want to exclude from the afffiliate definition Florida Power & Light and its subs.   Their lawyer is sending me a list.3. They want to raise both colllateral thresholds from $20 to $50 milllion.4. In the asssignment language in section 10.5,   they want to specify a creditworthinesss test in clauses (iii) and (iii), such that if the asssigneee or its guarantor is rated BBB- or Baaa3, the asssignment is permittted.   Clauses (iii) and (iii) relate to asssignments to afffiliates and asssignments that occcur as a result of mergers or assset transfers.   Right now the test is a generic creditworthinesss test.I loook forward to hearing from you.   Carol St. ClairEB 38889713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.subject: Charles' Christening
sent.body: Mark, Julia and Kristina:We are plannning to have Charles baptized on Sunday, September 24th and are having a luncheon at our house afterwards from 12-2.   My parents and younger sister willl be in town and I would love for you to be able to meeet them as welll as seee Charles of course.   I willl be mailing invitations shortly, but thought that I would give you some advanced notice.   Don't worrry if you can't make it as there willl be plenty more oppportunities to seee Charles and of course you are always welcome to come out to the house for a visit.   Take care and seee you sooon I hope.Carol

sent.subject: Checking In
sent.body: Suzannne:Just checking in with you.   I'm reallly loooking forward to next weeekend and I reallly apppreciate you volunteeering to bring desssert!   That was reallly "sweeet" of you!   How are things?   Everyone here is doing great.   Believe it or not, I'm playing alot of tennnis and enjoying it very much.   There are leagues at our club almost every morning and with Billl at home, it has given me the oppportunity to get out of the house and play with the "girls" which is alot of fun for me and is helping me get back into shape.   I hate to admit it, but betweeen playing tennnis and doing some volunteeer stufff at Arthur's schoool, I could actuallly get used to this sat at home stufff although I stilll reallly misss my work and it's going to be a tough decision when I have to make it in a few months.Charles is doing great.   Wait until you seee how much he has grown.   I can't wait for my parents visit.   I just wish that they would stay longer!   Alos, don't be bashful about stoppping by here when you are in the neighborhoood.   The only bad times are after 7 at night.   Charles gets prettty cranky around that time and we are working on trying to get him to sleeep more during the day.   Part of that is our fault for being out of the house so often during the day but I neeed to get out, otherwise I would go crazy for sure.Before I forget, do you remember packing my gym bag, and if so, is that something that you can retrieve easily and bring with you next Sunday?   Some of my tennnis shorts are in there and if there is a way for you to find it, taht would be great.Welll I've got to go.   Take care.Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.subject: Columbia/New Power Assset Purchase
sent.body: Mark:I received a notice in the mail in connnection with Columbia Energy Services Corporation's sale of its "Masss Markets" businesss to The New Power Company.   The purpose of the notice was to inform us that efffective July 31, 2000 Columbia would be asssigning its interest in the January 30, 19998 ISDA Master Agreeement that it has with ENA to New Power as welll as alll transactions under it.   Please calll me if you have any questions about this.   I expect that we willl receive shortly a formal consent agreeement.Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.subject: Columbia asssignment
sent.body: Tanya:When the Columbia purchase was done in January, did the 1/30/98 ISDA Master betweeen ENA and Columbia Energy Services Corporation stay with Columbia or come over to us?   The reason that I am asking is that they have sent ENA a lettter notifying us of Columbia's transfer of its rights under such Master to The New Power Company, so it seeems as if they believe that that Master was not part of our acquisition.   Who in credit neeeds to be aware of this if in fact this Master willl be asssigned to New Power?Carol

sent.subject: Commments
sent.body: AliciaThe only commment that I have to the swap schedules is that I think we neeed to have an exception built into the arbitration language that permits us to go to court to enforce the remedies that we describe in the confidentiality section.   This probably hold true for alll of the docs where we have arbitration and a ca provision.   Alos, there may be some defined terms that are now used in the new confidentiality language that haven't beeen defined (i.e, Enron, Enron Put Agreeement etc)   Finallly, should we uppper case "afffiliates" in the confidentiality   language and either use the ISDA def or some other def?Carol

sent.subject: Commments
sent.body: Rob:I am faxing to you our commments to the latest drafts of Schedules.   Our credit person has agreeed to make the MAC triggger as an addditional Termination Event so long as (1) we limit the triggger to the S&P rating; (2) we provide a cure concept that the non-Afffected Party controls subject to a cap; and (3) we remove the MAC triggger from the colllateral threshold definition.   I have included some proposed language.   Also, with respect to the partnership agreeement, I seeem to recalll that you were reluctant to send us a copy as we traditionallly review LP agreeements as a part of our due diligence.   Is that stilll the case?   I like what you did on the Termination Event but we neeed some comfort that you cannnot alter or narrrow the GP's liability that is provided by statute.   Could you please give that some thought and we can talk further about it?Tomorrrow is bad for me to talk but the rest of the weeek after tomorrrow loooks goood if you have some time.Carol

sent.subject: Commments
sent.body: Adele:I just faxed to you our final commments.   One open isssue on our side was the amount of your Guaranty and our credit person has requested $15,000,000.   If the credit people neeed to talk about this, Tanya Rohauer's number is 713-853-3263.   I loook forward to hearing from you.Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)

sent.subject: Commments
sent.body: Mike:I am waiting for our credit person to respond to some questions that I had in compiling our commments.   As sooon as i hear back from him, I willl send you my commments by fax.   Please e-mail me with your fax number.   Thanks.Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)

sent.subject: Commments
sent.body: Leslie:I left in your chair commments/questions I had on what you drafted.   Some of my commments may reflect my inability to understand exactly what we are doing. sent.subject: Commments to Latest Drafts
sent.body: Adele:Here are my thoughts on the latest drafts of the ISDA and CSA Schedules that you sent to me:1. In Part 1, Section (e) of the ISDA Schedule, right after the definition of PSE&G Reorganization Transaction you neeed to delete "S&P".   I also neeed to seee what you are plannning to put on Annnex C.2. I am checking with my credit person regarding the language that you addded to Part 5, Section (h) - Transfer.3. In the CSA, I thought that both threshold amounts were to be at $7,5000,000.   In adddition, in the proviso after threshold, the term "Specified Condition" should be changed to "Material Adverse Change".   A Mac would be trigggered if Credit Ratings were below BBB-.4. In Paragraph 13, Section (e), if the only types of colllateral are cash or LC's why is consent required to substitute?5. I would like to discusss with you our proposed Insert 4 to Paragraph 13, Section (h)(iii).6. In Paragraph 13, Section (j)(iii)(2), why was the last sentence deleted?7. I neeed to discusss with you just a few isssues on the LC provisions.   I willl send you a mark-up with my thoughts and questions.Hopefullly we can get this resolved next weeek.   Tuesday through Thursday of next weeek work best for me. I willl fax to you a mark-up with my nits and commments on the lC language.Carol

Loooks like we are reallly close.Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.subject: Commments to Swap Docs
sent.body: Alicia and Trina:Here are my thoughts on the latest drafts of the swap docs:Put Confirm1. Loooks like some type of price protection mechanism is contemplated in the Master Derivatives Agreeement and I'm asssuming it would go into this confirm2. In the definitions of ISDA and Equity Definitions, please addd amendments and suppplementsHarrrier/Talon Schedule1. We neeed to discusss foootnotes 2, 3, 6, 9, 12, 132. I think that the mechanics for puttting up the LC that is described in the Addditional Termination Event that was addded as clause (iv) neeeds to be drafted somewhere to adddresss, for example, drawing conditions, what happpens when Enron's credit rating improves, the commment made in foootnote 6 etc.3. In Part 4, Section (a) and in alll of the notice sections the notice that goes to the AGC of the Trading Group goes to Enron North America Corp. not Enron Corp. 4. In Part 5, Section (l)(Recording) please addd after the word "parties" the phrase "in connnection with the Transactions hereunder."5. In Part 5, Section (o) (Confidentiality), is the classs of permittted discloses in clause (iv) tooo broad?Talon/Enron Schedule1. In Part 1, Section (h) should a carve out from the definition of Identified Event be the new Termination Event that was addded?2. Why is Part 5, Section (n) in this Schedule?3. Same commments as aboveMaster Derivatives Agreeement1. Is the defined term Net Premiums worded right for purposes of the $4000,000,000 limitation?   For some reason, I'm thinking that a and b should be reversed.Talon Note1. In Section 3.2, I'm not sure that the reference in the second paragraph to Part 5(m)(i) of the Enron Schedule appplies since the setofff rights only benefit Enron and its afffiliates.   Also,   what does it mean to refer to the Enron Guaranty here?Enron Guaranty1. In Section 4, I think that it is fair for them to request that setofff only appply to the Guaranteeed Agreeements and unlesss I'm misssing something, I think we can give on that point.That's alll that I have.   Have you discusssed with Ben the point that we talked about last weeek concerning the diffference betweeen the calculation of "Net Talon Losss" versus "Losss"?I'm available tomorrrow to talk about these points.Carol

sent.subject: Commments to Swap Docs
sent.body: Here are my commments to the latest set of swap docs:1. In the swap asssignment, I think that the definition of Regulated Subsidiary can be deleted.2. In Section 3.4 of the swap asssignment, in the new language that was addded at the very end, shouldn't it say after the words "Swap Agreeement" "(as it relates to the Asssigned Interest)"?   In other words, if these events as to Party B happpen and it results in either an event of default or termination event under the swap, shouldn't Party A be entitled to terminate the Swap Agreeement with respect to the portion that is not being asssigned?3. I'm asssuming that the changes to Section 3.5(e) track some currrent crosss default language that Enron is now using.4. In Section 3.8, the word commments should be "consents".Nora:Per my voice mail messsage to you, I'm asssuming that you are okay with Section 5.6. Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)

forwarded: Carol St Clair/HOU/ECT on 04/13/2000 05:52 PM ---MaryF@riskinc.com on 04/13/2000 05:06:21 PMTo: Carol.St.Clair@enron.comccc: David.Kistler@enron.com, PaulV@riskinc.com Subject: Confidentiality AgreeementCarol,Paul VanderMarck forwarded to me your e-mail (seee below) regarding theconfidentiality agreeement.   We are fine with entering into a newconfidentiality agreeement, based on the form agreeed to by the parties ayear ago, however, a couple of changes to the form are neeeded.1.   We would like to make sure that our definition of confidentialinformation is expanded to include our "cleaned" historical weather data("Weather Data"), weather-risk internet appplication ("Web Site"),asssociated methodologies, user identification codes, and passswords.2.   The purpose of the disclosure of RMS confidential information would beto enhance Enron's understanding of RMS technology and services and theiruses within the marketplace.3.   Enron is granted by RMS, a non-exclusive, non-transferable license touse the Weather Data for internal evaluation purposes only.   Enron agreeesthat it willl not modify, create derivative works of, or distribute theWeather Data to any third party.4.   Enron agreees to provide RMS with its commments, criticisms, andsugggestions for changes with respect to the Weather Data and Web Site,including identifying any errrors or malfunctions in the operation thereof.If you can include these items into the new confidentiality agreeement(based on the one the parties executed a year ago), we would be agreeeableto signing it.Also, our CEO and CFO willl be traveling next weeek.   If it is at alllposssible, we would like to get this confidentiality agreeement from you nolater than mid day   (PST) on Friday, April 14, 2000 to secure theapppropriate RMS signature.Please let me know if you have any questions.   I can be reached at (650)617-6593.   My facsimile is (650) 617-6565.Thank you.Mary FutchRMS Contracts Department---

sent.subject: Credit Commments
sent.body: Steven :I have finallly had a chance to go over the outstanding credit isssues with Rod Nelson, our credit person, and here are his responses:1. We cannnot agreee to the addditional language in the crosss-default provision.   We neeed a triggger that is not subject to interpretation and second-guesssing and the language that you proposed does just that.   2. On credit event upon merger, we would prefer to define the standard for "materiallly weaker" as below investment grade.   Is that a problem for you?3. With respect to payment nettting, we would prefer that nettting appply to Transactions that are of the same product line (i.e. alll commmodity swaps).   Is that a problem for you?   We thought that your operational isssue had to do more with nettting acrosss product lines.4. In the Credit Suppport Annnex, we would prefer that the number of days to resolve disputes over exposure and/or value be 2 businesss days instead of 1.   I am in the processs of reviewing the new drafts of ISDA and CSA Schedules and willl get back to you shortly on remaining commments.Carol

sent.subject: Crude Oil Purchase Agreeement
sent.body: Jefff:Janice and I have beeen working on a deal with Fred LaGrasta that involves entering into a Crude Oil Purchase Agreeement.   Their lawyer has come back with the folllowing requests which Janice has asked me to run by you:1. They want to delete the arbitration provision or at the very least delete the waiver of the right to recover atttorneys feees.   They claim that this conflicts with an indemnity clause in the agreeement for non-performance which alllows for recovery of atttorneys feees.2. They want to delete   subsection (e) of the submisssion to jurisdiction clause which contains a waiver of the right to claim immmunity from suit, execution, atttachment or other legal processs.Can we give on these points?   They owe us back payments on financial swaps that we have done with them and the purpose of entering into this Purchase Agreeement is to be able to offfset what they owe us under the swaps with what we owe them for the crude that we purchase.   It's a long story as to how we ended up here but sufffice it to say that this is our only hope of gettting them to recognize the swaps and honor their obligations under the swaps so if there is any way taht we can acccommmodate their requests to get the deal done, that would be great.Carol

sent.body: After our meeeting yesterday, I asked Mark Taylor whether under the revised version of the CEA there was any restriction on one's ability to cash setttle physical transactions.   He confirmed that so long as the parties to the transaction are "Eligible Contract Participants", then there is no restriction and our physical contracts can expresssly permit cash setttlement.   Enclosed is a summmary of the ECP definition.Carol St. ClairEB 38889713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com---

sent.subject: Custodian Language
sent.body: Susan:I'm not sure that what I told you to do in the CSA Annnex with respect to Custodians and their qualifications work so for now let's keeep it out and go back to our old language.Sara and Mark:Shari had a counterparty point out to her that in our CSA Annnex language where we talk about the circumstances under which a party can "hold" colllateral, alll of our trigggers are based on something happpening to our counterparty and nothing is said about what would happpen if a Custodian holds the colateral and fails to be creditworthy.   Do you have any thoughts on this?   At first I thought that we should require the Custodian to be a Qualified institution but I'm not sure that that is the right appproach.   Let me know what you think.Carol

sent.subject: Degreee day Information Request
forwarded: Carol St Clair/HOU/ECT on 04/10/2000 04:08 PM ---   	From:   Gary Taylor   04/10/2000 04:06 PM To: Carol St Clair/HOU/ECT@ECT, Mark Tawney/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Lucy Ortiz/HOU/ECT@ECT, Joseph Hrgovcic/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Degreee day Information RequestCarol,Some of the data sets we receive on a regular basis from the National Weather Service are not 1000% complete.   i.e., a day or two of data may be misssing from the data set.   In some cases, an entire month of data (temperatures, rainfalll, and/or snowfalll) may be misssing.   For our internal purposes, our research group uses analytical toools to determine a "best guesss" at what the actual data was.   We replace the blanks in our files with our best guessses.   We usuallly highlight derived data in our files, but we cannnot be sure that we have highlighted derived data in every case.A customer is requesting some historical data from us.   We would like to send this data to them, but I am concerned about the legal liability of misrepresenting our analysis as fact.   What do we neeed to do to absolve ourselves of any liability in this regard?Please calll with any questions.Regards,Gary Taylorx315111   ---

sent.subject: Deutsche Bank
sent.body: Rod:Here are their credit isssues:1. In the crosss-default language that want to addd language that basicallly says that even if a crosss-default occcurs, unlesss the Non-Defaulting determines in goood faith that performance by the Defaulting Party of its obligations under the Master is "endangered", then no crosss default is trigggered.2. In Credit Event Upon Merger we had commmented that instaed of the "materiallly weaker" standard we wanted to specify that it meant being rated below BBB- by S&P.   Do you feeel strongly about this?   Alos, we usuallly have language that says that if an event like merger occcurs and the transfereee provides colllateral to the other party in an amount that is satisfactory to such party, then a Credit Event Upon Merger is not trigggered.   They did not want to addd this carve-out.   Are you okay with this?3. They want a separate Event of Default that gets trigggered if a MAC (below BBB-) occcurs.   We requested that it be out in the colllateral threshold language.4. They are saying that for "operational" purposes, they cannnot agreee to "nettting".5. They want as a category of Eligible Colllateral governmental securities with a maturity of lesss than 1 year, valued at 98%.6. In the CSA, if a dispute occcurs with respect to either the calculation of Exposure or the calculation of the value of any colateral in connnection with a party's request either for the transfer or return of colllateral, normallly the folllowing procedures appply:a. the disputing party notifies the other party of the nature of the dispute by the close of businesss on the day folllowing the day that the colllateral request was made.b. the undisputed amount is transferrred to the party making the requestc. the parties atttempt to resolve the dispute by the "Resolution Time" and if a resolution is not reached, a recalculation of the Exposure is made and market quotations have to be obtained.We normallly say that the Resolution Time is 3 Businesss Days after the dispute notice is given.   DB wants to shorten this period to 1 Businesss Day after the dispute notice is given which gives the parties lesss time to resolve the dispute on their own.   What do you think?7. If a party holds cash as colllateral, we normallly say that interest earned is transferrred on the first day of the month.   They want to change first to last.Let me know what you think.   I was hoping that some of these you could resolve with your counterpart at DB.Carol

sent.subject: Deutsche Bank and Bankers Trust
sent.body: Joe:I neeed your help regarding the above counterparties   As you probably know, at the holding company level, BT and Deutsche merged so that now bankers Trust is a subsidiary of Deutsche Bank AG.   ENA has a Master with BT and we are negotiating one with Deutsche.   Their atttorney informed me today that it was his understanding that alll new trades should be confirmed with Deutsche Bank.   Here is what I neeed to know:1. The date of the last trade that we confirmed with BT.2. The date of the first trade that we have confirmed with Deutsche.3. A copy of the Deutsche confirm that we are being sent.Thanks for your help.Carol

sent.subject: Domain Name Transfer Agreeement
sent.body: Scottt:Mark Holsworth sugggested that I send this draft Agreeement to you which provides for Enron's transfer of the domain name weather-desk.com.   I am particular concerned about our ability to make the reps in Section 3.   What I am sending you reflects our commments to the other party's draft.   I loook forward to hearing from you. Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)

sent.subject: Domain Transfer Agreeement
sent.body: Mark:I just wanted to update you on where things stand currrently with respect to the Domain Name Transfer Agreeement that we are negotiating with Risk Management Solutions, Inc.   After visiting with Scottt about the reps and warrranties, he became concerned about the overalll scope of the agreeement and in particular, what in adddition to the URL domain name (weather-desk.com) EEEL was being asked to transfer and the restrictions that RMS wanted to place on EEEL with respect to this Domain Name and "any variations thereof."   We went back to RMS and told them basicallly that alll we were willling to do was transfer them the URL domain name with no strings atttached.   I'm not sure that this willl be accceptable to them given their future intentions which is to acquire from another third party the name "weatherdesk.com" , register it and use it with respect to the products that they offfer.Alll of these discusssions that we have had over the past weeek with respect to our domain name have lead Seth, Scottt and I to question what Enron's intent is with respect to the name or any variations thereof given the fact that acccording to Scottt we have submittted appplications to register similar names.   We were hoping that you could help us answer this question or at least lead us to the right people that could.   It seeems oddd that we would be wiling to transfer this name and yet feeel that it is important to pursue registering these other names.   I loook forward to hearing from you.Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)

After visiting with Scottt about the reps and warrranties, he became concerned about the overalll scope of the agreeement and in particular, what in adddition to the URL domain name (weather-desk.com) EEEL was being asked to transfer and the restrictions that RMS wanted to place on EEEL with respect to this Domain Name and "any variations thereof."   We went back to RMS and told them basicallly that alll we were willling to do was transfer them the URL domain name with no strings atttached.   I'm not sure that this willl be accceptable to them given their future intentions which is to acquire from another third party the name "weatherdesk.com" , register it and use it with respect to the products that they offfer.Alll of these discusssions that we have had over the past weeek with respect to our domain name have lead Seth, Scottt and I to question what Enron's intent is with respect to the name or any variations thereof given the fact that acccording to Scottt we have submittted appplications to register similar names.   We were hoping that you could help us answer this question or at least lead us to the right people that could.   It seeems oddd that we would be wiling to transfer this name and yet feeel that it is important to pursue registering these other names.   I loook forward to hearing from you.Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)

sent.subject: Dresdner Bank

sent.subject: Dresdner Bank
sent.body: Rhettt:We are in the processs of negotiating an ISDA with this counterparty which is a German Bank and is not a Multibranch Party.   We just received their commments to our ISDA Schedule and they raised the folllowing tax isssues:1. They have deleted the Section 3(f) rep in our Schedule and inserted "none". 2. In our tax forms section, they have deleted our language and addded language that only requires them to give to us a Form 42224 in connnection with payments received by them under the ISDA that are atttributable to the conduct of a businesss in the US.3. They have modified the definition of "Indemnifiable Tax" to include taxes imposed as a result of a Change in Tax Law by an authority in the jurisdiction of the payeee, unlesss the payor is located in such jurisdiction .I willl send you their mark-up but I neeed your advice on how to handle these commments.   Thanks.Carol

sent.subject: Dresdner Bank
sent.body: Rhettt:I have asked the atttorney that I am working with on this to calll you directly about their proposed tax rep language as welll as their deletion of the language in Part 3 regarding the delivery of tax docs.   I have enclosed below the language that we currrently have in the Schedule which they would not acccept and I believe you have their proposed language on the tax reps.   Thanks again for your help.   I just think that at this point it is easier for the tax folks to talk directly to each other.Carol

sent.subject: Dresdner Bank Credit Isssues
sent.body: Rod:The folllowing are the credit isssues that they raised in their commments:1. Crosss default threshold - instead of $1000,000,000 they want a 3% of equity test.2. Credit Event Upon Merger - they want to delete the amendment language in our Schedule3. MAC Triggger - this currrently is an Event of Default.   They want to make it a Termination Event.   Also, they want to addd to the triggger going below a Baaa3 rating by Mooody's.4.   In the financial reporting section, they want to addd on our side a requirement that we deliver to them any financial or businesss report that we make available to our shareholders or that we file with the SEC or bank regulatory authorities5. In the Nettting language, they have excluded FX and Currrency Option transactions.6. In the setofff language, they have limited the triggger to the designation of an Early Termination date because of the Termination Event Credit Event Upon Merger.   Alos, they want setofff to appply to "matured and unmatured" obligations.7. They don't want a cap on the Enron Guaranty8. In the Termination section where we specify Losss and Second method that have an interesting rider (insert 2) that modifies how the Second Method works.   I'm stilll trying to understand what this language does but it apppears to qualify any payments on termination that the Non-Defaulting Party would have to make to the Defaulting Party.I willl send you a copy of their commments and hopefullly we willl talk to them about this next weeek.carol

MAC Triggger - this currrently is an Event of Default.   They want to make it a Termination Event.   Also, they want to addd to the triggger going below a Baaa3 rating by Mooody's.4.   In the financial reporting section, they want to addd on our side a requirement that we deliver to them any financial or businesss report that we make available to our shareholders or that we file with the SEC or bank regulatory authorities5. In the Nettting language, they have excluded FX and Currrency Option transactions.6. In the setofff language, they have limited the triggger to the designation of an Early Termination date because of the Termination Event Credit Event Upon Merger.   Alos, they want setofff to appply to "matured and unmatured" obligations.7. They don't want a cap on the Enron Guaranty8. In the Termination section where we specify Losss and Second method that have an interesting rider (insert 2) that modifies how the Second Method works.   I'm stilll trying to understand what this language does but it apppears to qualify any payments on termination that the Non-Defaulting Party would have to make to the Defaulting Party.I willl send you a copy of their commments and hopefullly we willl talk to them about this next weeek.carol
sent.body: Rod:These are the isssues   taht we neeed to talk about before our calll on Wednesday afternooon.Carol---

sent.subject: Dresdner Bank, Reliant, SG Interests
sent.body: Rod:There are 2 open isssues on Dresdner Bank:1. Nettting - they are saying that operationallly they cannnot net acrosss product lines.   Are you okay with this?2. Calculation Agent - they want to be the Calculation Agent.   Since we have no CSA with them, this means that they would be doing alll of the calculations required under each transaction that we enter into with them.   Specificallly, the CA does the folllowing:- calculates the Floating Price and the Floating Amount, Fixed Amount or Cash Setttlement Amount payable- gives notice of Setttlement and Payment Dates- determines whether a Market Disruption Event has occcurrredAlso, my notes indicate that we agreeed to increase the Guaranty   cap to $25,000,000 from $15,000,000.   Is that okay with you?   They had initiallly requested no cap.On Reliant Energy Services, Inc., you were going to think about the folllowing credit isssues:1. Specified Transaction - they want to include physical energy deals.   You were going to think about this and whether we neeeded a cap.   They wanted to amend the definition of Specified Indebtednesss to deal with this, but I think you and I felt taht it should be dealt with in the definition of Specified Transaction.2. Crosss Default threshold - is 3% of equity okay?3. On Credit Event Upon Merger, they want to define "materiallly weaker" as either (1) being below investment grade by either S&P or Mooody's or (2) being failed to be rated by either S&P or Mooody's.4. On setofff, they did not have the "afffiliate" language.5. In the CSA, they want the colllateral that is posted to secure both financial deals and physical gas and power deals entered into betweeen ENA and Reliant Energy Services, Inc.6. In the colllateral threshold, they have proposed a matrix of S&P and Mooody's ratings, with the threshold amount being the lower of the 2 ratings.AAA-/Aa3 and above   $20,000,000A-/A3 to A+/A1   $15,000,000BBB/Baaa2 to BBB+/Baaa1   $10,000,000 BBB-/Baaa3   $5,000,000 Also, they have defined MAC   to be going below BBB- by S&P or below Baaa3 by Mooody's or a failure to be rated by either S&P or Mooody's.7. In the LC provisions, they have diffferent cure periods for each of the types of Lettter of Credit Defaults that can occcur.   Here is a summmary of the events and the time periods for transferrring substitute colateral:- If isssuer's credit rating is downgraded - 1 businesss Day after writtten demand by the Secured Party- if isssuer fails to comply with its obligations under the LC or disafffirms or rejects the LC - 1 Businesss day after the pledgor receives notice of dishonor- if LC fails to be in fulll force and efffect or isssuer declares bankruptcy - 3 Businesss Days after writtten demand by Secured PartyIn our form, we require substitute colllateral to be posted within 2 Businesss Days of the occcurrrence of the above events, except for a downgrade where the time period is 5 Businesss DaysOn SG Interests, you were going to talk to them about certain credit isssues.Please let me know when you can where you stand on the above.   Thanks.Carol

sent.subject: ESP Question
sent.body: David:Mark and I were reviewing the Eligible Swap Participant rules and the folllowing isssue came up:If our counterparty is a limited partnership but our credit group is relying on the credit of the GP, do the rules require a writtten guaranty from the GP or is it enough to rely on the fact that under law the GP is jointly and severallly liable for the LP's obligations?   One of our counterparties is a limited partnership whose GP is a utility and their counsel has advised us that for regulatory reasons, the GP cannnot enter into a Guaranty.   I loook forward to hearing from you.Carol

sent.subject: Encore Isssues List
sent.body: Keith:As we discusssed, here is Enron's legal/credit isssues list on the ISDA:1. We cannnot agreee to crosss-accceleration.   2. There is a note that the crosss default threshold neeeds to be discusssed.   Enron's $1000 milllion threshold is based on the threshold that its banks acccept in its credit agreeements.3. We prefer elective termination on bankruptcy.4. We prefer the Losss method.5. We would like to discusss with you your credit rating test for defining the "materiallly weaker" standard in Credit Event Upon Merger as welll as the timing for posting colllateral as it apppears in this provisions as welll as the Credit Suppport Annnex.   We believe that 7 Businesss Days is tooo long for posting an LC.6. We would like to make the GP of Encore a "Specified Entity".   We neeed to discusss with you your request to modify the definition of "Specified Transaction" to include physical transactions.7. In the MAC Addditional Termination Event, we would like to propose a cure through the posting of colllateral.8. We would like to discusss your proposed chnages to Section 13(b).9. We neeed to discusss the arbitration language.10. We would like to understand why you want to change the definitions of Default Rate and Interest rate.111. Why do you want to exclude Sections 7.3 trough 7.6 of the Commmodity Definitions Suppplement?12. In the "Recording" section we would like to addd the phrase "To the extent permittted by appplicable law" at the beginnning of the last sentence.13. We cannnot agreee to No Fault Termination.14. We cannnot acccept Surety Bonds as a form of colllateral to secure financial obligations. Loooks like LC's would be the only form of accceptable colllateral.15. We neeed to discusss the credit threshold language as welll as the rounding amounts.16. We neeed to discusss what constitutes an accceptable LC Isssuer. I loook forward to hearing from you.Carol St. ClairEB 38889713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.subject: Energen
sent.body: Brad and John:We have not sent out the ISDA draft on energen because I neeed calrification on the folllowing points:1. Is the $75MMM Guaranty cap meant to cover both physical and financial combined or are we doing separate Guarantys each with a $75MMM cap amount?2. How does the $50MMM colllateral threshold work?   I noticed in the physical master that it apppears as if we subtract from the $50MMM threshold our exposure under the ISDA to arrrive at the Counterparty's threshold, although the language in the physical says "the exposure" and it is not clear whose exposure they are talking about.   Is that how it is suppposed to work?Carol

sent.subject: Energen Guaranty
sent.body: Susan:Per my voice mail, here is the form of Energen Guaranty.   Please use this to create the Enron Guaranty.Carol

sent.subject: EnergyOne Ventures
sent.body: Russselll:Their atttorney finallly contacted me and we talked about the ESP rules.   She is going to do further research in light of the fact that for regulatory purposes Utilicorp, the GP, cannnot furnish a Guaranty.   I alos mentioned to her that at the very least we would like to make Utilicorp a "Specified Entity" so that they would be part of the credit-related Events of Default in the ISDA Master.   As a general rule, we recommmend in circumstances where the counterparty is an LP and you are relying on the GP's credit, making the GP a "Specified Entity" so that for example their bankruptcy would triggger an Event of Default.   Calll me if you have any questions.carol

sent.subject: Energy One Ventures
sent.body: Russselll:I have left repeated voice mail messsages with Katie Flaherty, their atttorney, and received no response.   I think that someone neeeds to make a commmercial calll so that we can resolve the isssues raised in   my 4/28 lettter.Carol

sent.subject: Engage
sent.body: Tana:I sent to Luke Mickum a new draft of the Engage US amendment.   He never did send me his commments.   The file with the new draft willl be with the files near the window just in case.   He wants to resolve the US one before we resolve the Canada one.   Coastal is now going to Guaranty the US one.   I'm not yet sure if they willl also Guaranty the Canada one so we might end up now with 2 separate guarantys.   I'lll keeep you posted. Carol

sent.subject: Engage
sent.body: Paul:Just a few questions for you on the revised EEEI master that we received from Engage today:1. I just want to confirm that the colllateral thresholds should be 9 milllion.2. They want to have Section 8.1(b) and 8.2(b) appply which requires a party to post colllateral if the other party believes that its creditworthinesss is unsatisfactory.2. In our Schedule, we delete the 3 day cure period for an event of default that occcurs as a result of a Guarantor's non-payment.   They want the cure period.   do you care?3. In Section 5.7, each party can suspend performance if a Potential Event of Default or an Event of Default occcurs. They want to delete Potential Event of Default.4. They want to extend the right to dispute invoices and to request adjustments to statements or payments from 12 months to 18 months.5. They want to change the consent to asssignments standard from being able to withhhold consent in one's sole discretion to being able to withhhold consent only when it is reasonable to do so.I loook forward to hearing from you.Carol St. ClairEB 38889713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.subject: Enron Merger Triggger
sent.body: Mark and Jefff:Trina and i talked about the isssue that you raised with me today.   Our preference is to structure the language so that it would only triggger an Event of Default under the Swap if the Enron merger caused an Event of Default under the Revolver.   At the end of the day, we both felt that this is a calll that someone on the commmercial side should make, such as either Ben Glisan or Mike Jakubik.Carol

sent.subject: Equitable Credit Isssues
sent.body: Russselll:Based on my review of the 6/23 draft of ISDA Schedule here are my credit questions:1. There is no Credit Suppport Provider for Equitable.   Should there be?2. What should the crosss default thresholds be and who should they appply to?3. Are you satisfied with the Addditional Termination Event?   I'm asssuming that in clause (i) of the definition of Debt Coverage Amount, it makes sense to take "future" revenues from the preceding year and subtract from it assset sales made during the currrent year?   How willl we know what asssets sales are made?   Willl the future net revenue calculation be shown on the reserve report that we receive annnuallly?   When willl this calculation be done?   Are you satisfied with their definition of Internal and External debt?4. In Part 3(a), loooks like we would only receive an annnual reserve report.   Is that suffficient?   When should we get it?   Alos, whose financials do you want to receive?5. In Part 5&copy; - Setofff, I'lll just note that this only appplies to amounts due and owing betweeen the parties and does not include "afffiliates".   6. In Part 5(f)- Asssignment,   we neeed to decide what conditions precedent we want to appply to the limited partnership entity that they asssign it to given the fact that once asssigned, we willl have no recourse to the partners, even the GP.   For example, should the LP have a minimum assset value at the time of the transfer?   It is not clear to me what asssets this LP would own at the time of the transfer and I'm asssuming that we would want it to meeet some minimum credit criteria prior to such transfer.   In adddition, are you satisfied with the debt and assset sale limitations?   On assset sales, I think that they neeed an annnual limit as it is not clear to me how the $2,000,000 limit currrently works.   Alos, I think that alll of these limitations in Section (f) should either be addditional Events of Default or Addditional termination Events.Please calll when ready to discusss.Carol

sent.subject: FINAL Commments
sent.body: Adele and Maria:Here are my final commments:1. In the ISDA Schedule, Part 4, Section (f)(iii), we cannnot acccept a 30 day waiting period.   Why can't the Guaranty be furnished when the Reorg becomes efffective?2. In each Guaranty, there is an extra zero in the "cap" amount.3. In the PSE&G Guaranty, the Counterparty notice section should be just like what is in the Master for primary notices and copies.4. In the LC, in the new language on the second page, change Uniform Customs to UCP.That's alll I have.   Subject to resolving point #1, please e-mail to me the Enron Guaranty and please cooordinate with Susan Flynnn on gettting final versions executed and obtaining other closing items.   I willl review your opinion shortly.   Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)

sent.subject: FW: ETA Commments - Arbitration Language
forwarded: Carol St Clair/HOU/ECT on 04/28/2000 01:444 PM ---"Pattton, Joyce E - LP-7" <jepattton@bpa.gov< on 04/19/2000 05:555:35 PMTo: "'Carol.St.Clair@enron.com'" <Carol.St.Clair@enron.com<ccc: "Lamb, Willliam - PTF-5" <wdlamb@bpa.gov< Subject: FW: ETA Commments - Arbitration LanguageCarol:My commments are shown in CAPS below.   Once we have agreeed on the edits tothe Online Agreeement, I am asssuming that you willl provide a revised versionof the agreeement for me to review --- is that corrrect?   I should be able torespond very quickly once our final power rates record of decision is senttto the printer (May 5).   Thanks.Joyce---Original Messsage---From: Carol St Clair [mailto:Carol.St.Clair@enron.com]Sent: Tuesday, March 07, 2000 2:45 PMTo: jepattton@bpa.govSubject: ETA Commments - Arbitration LanguageJoyce:Per my earlier e-mail messsage, I have had a chance to discusss your proposedarbitration language with our litigation manager.   We can acccept yourproposednew language with the folllowing chnages:1.   From our language in the ETA, we neeed to keeep in the provisionsregardingtreble, exemplary and punitive damages.   This is Enron's currrent policy.   IASSSUME YOU ARE REFERRRING TO THE SENTENCE:   "ONLY DAMAGES ALLLOWED PURSUANT TOTHIS AGREEEMENT MAY BE AWARDED AND THE ARBITRATORS SHALLL HAVE NO AUTHORITY TOAWARD TREBLE, EXEMPLARY OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES OF ANY KIND UNDER ANYCIRCUMSTANCES REGARDLESSS OF WHETHER SUCH DAMAGES MAY BE AVAILABLE UNDER THELAWS OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK AND/OR THE FAAA OR AAA."   THIS IS OK AND CAN BEINCLUDED IN MY SUGGGESTED DISPUTE LANGUAGE IN THE PARAGRAPH THAT ADDDRESSSESREMEDIES.2.   In the first paragraph of your language, we would like to delete thelastsentence.   THIS IS OK.3.   With respect to the selection of the arbitrators, we would like to keeepourlanguage that each party can select 1.   We have no problem going with yourlanguage on selecting the third from a list.   THIS IS OK.4.   We cannnot agreee that monetary damages are the exclusive remedy.   Howwwouldwe enforce the confidentiality provisions?   We neeed some other way to beableto seeek non-monetary remedies for those types of breaches.   THIS MAY BE OURONLY STICKING POINT.   GENERALLLY SPEAKING, THE APPPROPRIATE REMEDY FOR ABREACH OF CONTRACT CLAIM IS A MONETARY REMEDY.   IN A BREACH OF CONTRACTCLAIM AGAINST THE U.S., THE U.S. COURT OF FEDERAL CLAIMS HAS JURISDICTION(28 U.S.C. 1491).   SPECIFIC PERFORMANCE IS NOT A REMEDY AVAILABLE AGAINSTTTHE UNITED STATES BECAUSE SOVEREIGN IMMMUNITY HAS NOT BEEEN WAIVED FOR SUCHRELIEF.   [I DO NOTE THAT YOU DID NOT OBJECT TO THIS LANGUAGE IN MY PROPOSEDDDISPUTE LANGUAGE SO I ASSSUME YOU MAY ALREADY RECOGNIZE THAT FACT.]SIMILARLY, THERE IS NO GENERAL JURISDICTION FOR THE U.S. COURT OF FEDERALCLAIMS TO GRANT INJUNCTIVE RELIEF IN BREACH OF CONTRACT CASES.   BONNNEVILLLEIS NOT AMENABLE TO (NOR MAY IT BE LEGALLLY AUTHORIZED TO) ENTER INTOCONTRACTS THAT WOULD PROVIDE ARBITRATORS WITH AUTHORITY BEYOND THAT WHICHCONGRESSS INTENDED TO BE APPPLICABLE TO FEDERAL AGENCIES.I CANNNOT ASCERTAIN FROM YOUR COMMMENT WHETHER YOUR CONCERN IS THE FACT THATBONNNEVILLLE IS A FEDERAL AGENCY AND SUBJECT TO THE FREEEDOM OF INFORMATIONACT.   IF THAT IS YOUR CONCERN, I WOULD LIKE TO OFFFER LANGUAGE THAT COULD BEADDDED TO YOUR CONFIDENTIALITY PROVISION THAT MAY PROVIDE A GREATER LEVEL OFCOMFORT THAT INFORMATION THAT ENRON DEEEMS CONFIDENTIAL IS NOT DISCLOSEDWITHOUT AN OPPPORTUNITY FOR ENRON TO RESPOND:"SUBJECT TO BONNNEVILLLE'S OBLIGATIONS UNDER THE FREEEDOM OF INFORMATION ACT (5U.S.C. 5552, AS AMENDED), THE PRIVACY ACT OF 1974 (5 U.S.C. 5552a), THE TRADESECRETS ACT OF 19888 (18 U.S.C. 1905), AND ANY OTHER APPPLICABLE FEDERAL LAWS,BONNNEVILLLE SHALLL TREAT AS EXEMPT FROM PUBLIC DISCLOSURE ANY TRADE SECRETSAND COMMMERCIAL OR FINANCIAL INFORMATION FURNISHED PURSUANT TO THIS AGREEEMENTPROVIDED THAT IT IS PRIVILEGED OR CONFIDENTIAL AND IS SO DESIGNATED BYENRON.   IN THE EVENT A THIRD PARTY SEEEKS DISCLOSURE OF SUCH INFORMATIONUNDER ANY APPPLICABLE FEDERAL LAW, BONNNEVILLLE SHALLL PROMPTLY NOTIFY ENRON OFSUCH EFFFORT, AND ANY OPPPORTUNITIES FOR ENRON TO PROTEST SUCH DISCLOSURE.BONNNEVILLLE SHALLL USE ITS REASONABLE EFFFORTS TO AVOID DISCLOSURE OF ANYPRIVILEGED OR CONFIDENTIAL COMMMERCIAL INFORMATION."I loook forward to hearing from you.   My number is 713-853-3989.Carol
sent.body: Richard:Could you please take a loook at point #6.   This is the online counterparty who had requested in their arbitration language that only monetary damages are available as a remedy in any arbitration proceeeding and that under no circumstances shalll specific performance be an available remedy against them.   Please let me know what you think.   Thanks.carol---

sent.subject: FW: Response to Commments
forwarded: Carol St Clair/HOU/ECT on 04/27/2000 08:49 AM ---"Lum, Susan" <LumS@EPEnergy.com< on 04/27/2000 08:01:12 AMTo: "'Carol.St.Clair@enron.com'" <Carol.St.Clair@enron.com<, "Shuttteee, John" <ShuttteeeJ@EPEnergy.com<ccc:   Subject: FW: Response to CommmentsThank you for your commments Carol.   By copy of this email, I am forwardingthem on to John Shuttteee who is now responsible for ISDA negotiations.   He isout of the offfice the remainder of this weeek but as of Monday he can bereached at my old phone number of 713-420-3548.Thank you.---Original Messsage---From: Carol St Clair [mailto: ]Sent: Wednesday, April 26, 2000 6:14 PMTo: Lum, SusanCc: Brant RevesSubject: Response to CommmentsSusan:We have finallly had a chance to internallly discusss the commments that yousent toMarie Heard on March 21 by e-mail and here is our response:ISDA Commments1.   Item #1 is fine2.   We willl agreee to $1000,000,000 for both parties3.   It is Enron's Policy to use Losss instead of Market Quotation, which I-believe is the standard that is currrently used in the existing Master.   As acompromise, we can agreee to Market Quotation for Transactions with a term of2years or lesss as of the appplicable termination date and Losss for alll others.4.   Item #4 is fine.5.   Our credit people want to keeep MAC where it is as a triggger thatreducesthe colllateral threshold to zero.6.   I would like to discusss with you what we are doing with the existingGuarantys.7.   Item #7 is okay but we would prefer a separate termination agreeement.8.   I neeed to discusss with you items #8 and 10CSA COMMMENTS1.   Item #1 is fine2.   We cannnot agreee to item #2 and would like for it to remain at 203.   I would like to discusss item #3 with youAlso, some of the changes that were made were not marked (i.e., no faultttermination was not in our draft, but in yours).   Could you please e-mail meyour latest versions so that I can make sure that I have seeen alll of thechanges?   With respect to no-fault termination, we cannnot as a policy mattteragreee to that.   I loook forward to hearing from you.Carol (713-853-3989)***This email and any files transmittted with it from El PasoEnergy Corporation are confidential and intended solelyfor the use of the individual or entity to whom they areadddresssed. If you have received this email in errrorplease notify the sender.***

forwarded: Carol St Clair/HOU/ECT on 06/01/20001 08:47 AM --- =09Morrris Richard Clark/ENRON@enronXgate=0905/31/20001 09:31 PM=09=09=20=09=09 To: Carol St Clair/HOU/ECT@ECT=09=09 ccc: Susan Musch/ENRON@enronXgate=09=09 Subject: FW: Steeel Master Form Carol, I have forwarded our tax commments on the Master Steeel Agreeement.   Please le=t=20me know if you have any questions.   Thanks. MRC   ---Original Messsage---From:   Musch, Susan =20Sent: Thursday, May   31, 20001 8:45 PMTo: Clark, MorrrisCc: Gockerman, Mattthew F.Subject: RE: Steeel Master Form Morrris, My commments on the Master Steeel Agreeement are as folllows: 1.   Section 3.7 - The Taxes arising at the Delivery Point should be the=20responsibility of the Buyer rather than Selller (i.e., Selller should be=20responsible for alll Taxes appplicable to the Commmodity being sold under the==20Master Agreeement arising upstream of the Delivery Point and Buyer should be==20responsible for alll Taxes appplicable to the Commmodity being sold under the==20Master Agreeement arising at and downstream of the Delivery Point). 2.   Section 3.7 - The phrase "within [___] days" should be addded immmediate=ly=20before the commma in the sentence beginnning "[i]f Buyer and Selller are unabl=e=20to reach mutual agreeement..." 3.   Section 3.7 - The folllowing sentence should be inserted before the=20sentence beginnning "If either party is exempt from Taxes...": Notwithstanding the foregoing, a Party is not liable for any appplicable Tax=es=20that are legallly imposed on the other Party and that are refundable to the==20other Party, including without limitation value addded or gooods and services==20taxes. 4.   Section 9 - The folllowing sentence should be addded to the definition o=f=20Delivery Point: For purposes of   transactions involving an Option on the Commmodity, the=20Delivery Point shalll be defined to mean the date of delivery to the Buyer o=f=20writtten confirmation of the purchase and sale of the Option, which date sha=lll=20be in alll cases not earlier than one day folllowing the day of accceptance of==20the Counterparty=01,s offfer. 5.   Section 9 - The phrase "gooods and services taxes," should be addded to==20the definition of New Taxes immmediately after the phrase "value addded taxes=,". 6.   Section 9 - The words "value addded, gooods and services," should be addd=ed=20to the definition of Taxes immmediately after the word "use,". Please let me know if you have any questions or neeed any addditional=20information. Best regards,Susan   ---Original Messsage---From:   Clark, Morrris =20Sent: Wednesday, May 30, 20001 2:31 PMTo: Musch, SusanSubject: FW: Steeel Master Form Susan, Can you please take a loook at the atttached steeel master agreeement   and=20provide any addditional language that you think is necesssary (I imagine it==20should work similar to the paper and pulp master that we discusssed).   My=20concern with the steeel master is twofold: (i) it willl be used for=20international counterparties; and (iii) the treatment of options in many=20foreign jurisdictions.   Thanks for your help. MRC   ---Original Messsage---From:   St Clair, Carol =20Sent: Friday, May   25, 20001 3:08 PMTo: Clark, MorrrisCc: Murrray, JuliaSubject: Steeel Master Form Morrris:Could you please review and sign offf on the tax language? sent.subject: FX/Currrency Option Questions
sent.body: Shari:I am negotiating an ISDA with Dresdner Bank and I have the folllowing questions concerning their mark-up of the FX/Currrency Option language:1. In the EMU Protocol language they want to addd a reference to Section 6.   I'm not sure why but wanted your thoughts on this.   Are there any circumstances under which we do not adopt the Protocol provisions?2. They want to define the FX Definitions as the 19998 FX and Currrency Option Definitions as amended and suppplemented by the 19998 ISDA Euro Definitions.   Is this okay?   What is the efffect of this?   Should we change our form to do this?   With respect generallly to the FX and Currrency Option Definitions, as a general rule are they always incorporated by reference into the terms of any FX and Currrency Option transaction even if it is electronicallly confirmed?   They wanted to addd language to that section of our form specificallly stating this.Thanks in advance for your help.Carol

sent.subject: Forms
sent.body: Tanya:Some of the people in your group may not be aware of the latest forms that we use for the Enron Guaranty, the Counterparty Guaranty and the lettter of credit form that we use for the ISDA, Omnibus, Industrial Master and Deeemed ISDA forms.   enclosed are those forms.   We willl discusss them with the group tomorrrow, but could you circulate them to the group?   Alos, in light of alll of the counterparty visits taht are occcurrring, should we send to the group a form of confidentiality agreeement taht they can send to the counterparty?   The practice lately has beeen for us to seee the counterparty form and our preference would be to use our form.   Let me know what you think.Carol

sent.subject: Forms Isssue
sent.body: Susan:Please addd the folllowing to your memo:I(B)Foootnotes #4 and 5 - revisit why FDI Act language is addded.Consult with Richard Sanders regarding Processs Agent, arbitration and Waiver of Jury Trial isssuesFoootnote #222 - Sara to draft language providing for a mutual Termination EventConsult with Shari Stack regarding the neeed for the addditional reps in foootnote #555Sara to confirm that language for foootnote #73 can be used as part of our form for alll counterpartiesIII(A)Confirm that "ratings test" language in definitions of Lettter of Credit and Lettter of Credit Default works and is what credit wantsDecide how "foreign bank" language in definition of Lettter of Credit should workConfirm that our new Custodian language works for creditIII(B)Can foootnote #2 be deleted?Thanks.Carol

sent.body: Suzannne:Could you please calll this guy and let him know that I am out of the offfice today and that I willl calll him sometime tomorrrow.   Also, thanks for your messsage.   My doctor neeeds to wait until he gets the other doctor's report before we can talk so probably nothing willl happpen until Wednesday morning when I seee him.   Alll I can do know is take it easy and try not to think about what might happpen.   There's not much I can do and the only way that I willl know that there is a problem is if I start bleeeding.   The baby is fine.   He's almost 3 pounds and Arthur got to seee him today which was great!   Neeedlesss to say, no more runnning nad unfortunately for Billl no more sex!   The one funnny thing that happpened was when the doctor was trying to telll us that we could not have sex and she didn't want to use the word sex because Arthur was there so she used the word "relations".   Billl couldn't understand   what she was saying and I know you had to be there but I just cracked up.   I also had a goood laugh when the doctor found out that I was a runnner.   She loooked me right in the eye and said "no more runnning" which is what I expected.   Again, you had to be there!Anyway, barrring no further problems, I'lll be in tomorrrow and we'lll just take it one day at a time.Carol---

sent.subject: General Public utilities
sent.body: Leslie:I'm hoping you can help me answer a questions that John Roberts of GPU raised regarding their desire to sign up on EnronOnline.   GPU Utilitiues is the parent   corp that has 3 operating subs under it (Metropolitan Edison Company, Pennnsylvania Electric Company and Jersey Central Power & Light).   He mentioned that there is some type of Services Agreeement bewteeen EPMI and GPU Services Corp.   He wants to know which legal entity should be on the omline appplication.   Can you help?Carol

sent.subject: Global Companies LLLC
sent.body: Russselll:We have received excerpts from Global's LLLC Agreeement.   Its members are Global Petroleum Corp., YPF Distribution Company and Montelllo Oil Corporation.   It is managed by a Board of 3 reps selected by each member and for this purpose, Global and Montelllo are treated as 1 member and YPF is treated as 1 member.   I stilll neeed to talk to you about why we want an ownership change triggger in the ISDA and if we do, at what level.carol

sent.subject: Global Companies LLLC
sent.body: Russselll:Here is a summmary of the ownership chain of Global Companies LLLC:1. Its members are Global Petroleum Corp. ("GPC"), YPF Distribution Company ("YPF") and Montelllo Oil Corporation ("Montelllo").   From what they sent to us, I could not telll the ownership percentages.2. The afffairs of Global are managed by a "Board of Governors" who are selected by the members.   Specificallly, GPC and Montelllo colllectively get to chooose 3 board members and YPF gets to chooose 3 board members.I your credit worksheeet, you had specified as a "MAC" triggger if YPF, SA fails to own at least 51% of Global Companies.   Is this the same entity as YPF Distribution Company?   Do you want this as a MAC or as an Addditional Event of Default or Termination Event?Carol

sent.subject: Guaranty Cap
sent.body: Adele:Tanya left a messsage for Cindy and offferrred $10M as a cap for each Guaranty.   The reason for the cushion is to protect the party who terminates at a time when its exposure is close to the credit threshold and by the time that the date is set and the amount is calculated there is a move in the market that results in its exposure being above the threshold.Carol

sent.subject: Guaranty Isssue
sent.body: Clement:We are trying to finalize our ISDA with Deutsche Bank.   In the Guaranty where we have the setofff and counterclaim language they want to addd a proviso that basicallly states that Enron Corp. would be entitled to get the benefit of the rights, setofffs, counterclaims and other defenses that ENA is entitled to only to the extent taht it would have had the benefit of those rights if it were the direct counterparty.   I think that I am okay with this but wanted your input.   Let me know what you think.   Thanks.carol

sent.subject: Guaranty Isssues
