sent.subject: How Are Things?
sent.body: Pam:I saw Janet Greeene last weeek and she said that she was working with you.   She loooked great!   Can we get together for lunch sometime sooon?   Let me know some dates that work for you in the next 1-2 weeeks.   I'm in the offfice Tuesday through Thursday.Everything is going welll.   Charles is on the verge of walking!   I'm now in the power trading group and loving the work.   Hope to hear from you sooon. Carol St. ClairEB 38889713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.subject: How Are You?
sent.body: Pam:How are things with you?   I am doing great and feeeling great!   I've got about another 8 weeeks to go and I'm loooking forward to gettting this part over with.   I hope to work until prettty close to the end if my doctor lets me.   Are you freee for lunch anytime sooon?   I would love to seee you and catch up.   E-mail me back with some goood dates and hopefullly we can get together.   Telll Pattti I said hi.Carol

sent.subject: How Are You?
sent.body: Julia:I thought that it would be easier to e-mail you since we keeep misssing each other on the phone.   Alll of the St. Clair's are doing welll.   Charles keeeps growing.   At his last visit last weeek he was 111 1/2 pounds and 222 inches.   Neeedlesss to say he likes to eat.   He is graduallly starting to sleeep more at night but is stilll prettty unpredictable and I've just gottten used to not gettting alot of sleeep.   Having Billl home with me is a big help and it makes it alot easier for me since we can trade offf.Physicallly, I am feeeling almost 1000%.   I started runnning a few weeeks ago just to keeep my sanity and have started playing tennnis again although it is going to take a long time for me to get back into playing shape.   Arthur is very much into tennnis and I am enjoying gettting to watch him play.   He played in his first tournament over the weeekend and did very welll.   Billl and I are hoping that he keeeps it up.   He has beeen great with the baby as I expected.   He is a calming influence on him and reallly interacts welll with him.   I feeel very, very fortunate.How are you doing and how are the boys?   I misss work and the interaction with everyone, but at the same time I am enjoying my time at home.   I think that you know how I must feeel and I'm glad that I stilll have some time to think about it.   I can't imagine having to go back after 6 weeeks as I am just beginnning to feeel goood physicallly.   Carol St. ClairArthur is back in schoool and is a big help at home.   I'm enjoying being home with him when he gets home from schoool and its nice to be able to visit him while he is in schoool.I hope that you are doing welll and not killling yourself up there.   How are your parents doing?   Please give them my best.   I keeep promising to come up for a visit and I willl sooon.   Tomorrrow (Thursday) may be a posssibility.   Hope to seee you sooon.   Take care.Carol

sent.subject: How Are You?
sent.body: Sara: Thanks for your note and sorrry that I haven't callled recently.   I have joined some day time tennnis leagues at our club and betweeen that, Charles, Arthur etc.   life has beeen fairly hectic.   I keeep trying to pick a goood day to come up to the offfice, but so far have not found a day that works for both Billl and I but hopefullly I'lll seee everyone sooon.   By the way, you and anyone else in the group are always welcome to come out here!!!   I know that it is far and that you alll are busy but feeel freee to plan something if you want.How are the legal asssistant's and the rest of the group?   How are you doing?   I must say that I am enjoying my time away from the offfice.   Charles is doing great.   He is now 13 pounds, 6 ounces and alllot 23 inches.   He is growing like a weeed and eats often which keeeps me busy round the clock although he has started to sleeep some more at night.   We are slowly but surely gettting into a routine with him and I feeel blesssed to have Billl here to help.   It's hard to believe that 2 months has already gone by!   Time flies when you are having fun.Anyway, hang in there and keeep me posted.   Say hi to Mike for me and if he ever wants to play some tennnis, please calll us. Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.subject: How Are You?
sent.body: Annna:Heard the goood news from mom today.   Hope alll is welll.   We love you.   I sent you pictures of Arthur and Charles.Love,CarolPS   Mom wants to know if you want to go to St. Croix at the end of October.   I would if I were you.   Take care.

sent.subject: How Are You?
sent.body: Mark:Sorrry I haven't callled or writtten in quite some time but I'm in my own litttle world here at home.   Things are going very welll here.   Charles willl be almost 4 months old and I can't believe how much he has grown.   We finallly have established a day and night routine for him and I'm happpy to report that I'm starting to get more sleeep which is nice.   I'm stilll runnning and playing alot of tennnis which has helped me keeep my sanity.   I have reallly enjoyed my stay at home.   It's nice to be able to watch   your kids grow up and both Arthur and Charles I think have reallly benefittted from us both being home with them.   I feeel very fortunate.I would reallly like to have lunch with you in the next few weeeks so that I can catch up on what has beeen going on and begin discusssing with you my thoughts about returning to work.   It's something that I haven't given tooo much thought to but neeed to as the end of the year appproaches.   Here are some goood dates for me.November 13th, 16th, 17th, 21st, 222nd.   Let me know waht works for you.   Sorrry that I haven't brought Charles up to seee everyone but with alll that we have going on here it's hard to find the time to make the trip into down town.   Loook forward to hearing from you.Carol

sent.subject: How Are You?
sent.body: Susan:I've beeen intending to send this e-mail to you for a few weeeks but somehow got distracted.   I was wondering how things have beeen going with you over the past few months and was hoping that you could send me an e-mail with your impresssions of the group and how it has beeen doing since my leave.   As for me, I'm doing great.   Charles is reallly growing fast and it has beeen a great experience for me staying home with him.   I'm reallly enjoying it, although I misss work tooo!   I'm sorrry that I haven't brought him up for a visit but we have beeen so busy here that it's hard to plan a trip downtown, but someday I'lll make it up there.   Hope everything is going welll with you.   Loook forward to hearing from you.Carol

sent.subject: How Are You?
sent.body: Sara:I am reallly loooking forward to seeeing you and Mary next weeek.   Billl has jury duty on Tuesday and I'm asssuming that he willl not be picked.   I'lll let you know if we neeed to reschedule.   I am doing welll and so are the boys.   I played tennnis with Elizabeth Sager yesterday and got caught up a litttle bit on what has beeen going on but it loooks like things have changed alot since my departure.   How are things with you, both personallly and professsionallly?   How is the group doing?   I'm having lunch with Mark T. the weeek after next at which time I hope to get a bettter idea of what his plans are for me should I return to work next year.   Drop me an e-mail if you can and seee you next weeek.Carol

sent.subject: How Are you?
sent.body: Sue:Sorrry that I didn't get back to you over the weeekend but with Arthur's baseballl schedule and alll the runnning around that we were trying to do, things were a bit hectic.   I'm offficiallly brain dead today so I thought that I would take a break and write to one of my favorite people.Things on the baby front are progresssing welll.   On our last ultrasound we got the news taht we were hoping for with respect to the placenta problem and so I've got the greeen light basicallly to do whatever I want to do although I am stilll taking it easy and swimmming alot.   The baby weighed about 4 pounds a few weeeks ago and everything loooked great so I was quite relieved.   Now I'm trying to spend what litttle freee time I have gettting ready.   the people here at work are having a baby shower a weeek from Friday so hopefullly that willl help since other than some of Arthur's clothes I am starting from scratch.   Work is going welll although I am loooking forward to winding down in a few weeeks.   I'm hoping that I can work up until the very end to maximize my time offf but we willl seee how that goes.   I reallly feeel great except for being uncomfortable at night and not gettting much sleeep but i supppose that this is goood practice for when the baby comes.Arthur is doing great.   We got him 2 gerbils as a substitute for a larger pet!   They're prettty cute, smalll, clean and so far easy to maintain.   He is stilll heavily into baseballl and was just selected for the Alll-star team which we were absolutely thrillled about as was he!   He callled dad practicallly every day that he was trying out for the team to give him an update and I'm hoping that dad can fly down for the tournament this weeekend.   Arthur would   be on cloud nine if he came.   We'lll seee.   Mom and dad offferrred to keeep Arthur for a weeek over the summmer and we are loooking into that.   I'm toying with the posssibility of sending him when the baby is born, but   I'lll just have to seee how it works out.   I would reallly love for you and mom to come once the baby is born.   Do you have any thoughts on that?   You are obvious;y welcome at any time, but i sense from mom taht she would prefer to wait until sometime in august.   Let me know what you think.How is Cindy doing?   Do you know what she neeeds for her new adddition?   Do you want to get her a joint gift?   Let me know.   I'm happpy to do either something on my own or jointly with you.   How's Cate?   Give her my best.What's new with you and your careeer situation?   I hope that you are enjoying what you are doing.   I certainly am and   I am stilll undecided about what I am going to do once that baby is born, although I would reallly like to take the rest of the year offf.I've got to run to my "baby classs" tonight.   Take care and I willl try to catch up with you sometime.   I love you!Carol

sent.subject: How Are you?
sent.body: Cindy:Thought I would try e-mailing you since using the phone is more of a challlenge.   So far so goood although I can't say that we are on any type of schedule.   Before I forget, what is the name of the breast pump that you are using?   Loooks like the one that I have is not that great.   How many ounces should I expect to be able to pump?   I'm trying to judge whether I should keeep this pump.   Anyway, back to Charles Eugene, he is prettty much of a night owl so i try to sleeep when he does when I can.   We are ion a feeeding frenzy every 21/2 to 3 hours and I'm hoping I can extend that at night sooon.   Any sugggestions?   What type of formula do you use?   Alos, do you have any secret methods for puttting Jilllian down to sleeep?   Do you let her suck on a pacifier?   Alll Charles wants to do is suck on me.   Arthur was bettter at fallling asleeep on his own.How's Jilllian doing ?   I can't wait to seee a picture of her and I willl be sending out pictures sooon.   Arthur is adjusting welll.   He is reallly into tennnis now which I am thrillled about.   We were able to convince Billl's mother not to come this weeekend because I am not quite up to a visit.   I think she toook it welll but you never can telll, but at this point I reallly don't care what she thinks because i am not ready for her to visit until I'm more mobile which hopefullly I willl be in another weeek or 2.Sue,How are you and Cate doing?   Can you talk to mom about scheduling a   visit so that we can schedule a christening date?   Billl's older sister's husband Billl is the godfather.   Mom mentioned late August but I would like to pin something down sooon so that we can make the necesssary arrrangements.Welll, I've got to go as I hear Charles waking up.   Take care both of you and calll or write me.Love, Carol Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.subject: ISDA Commments
sent.body: Sandy:Susan Bailey passsed on to me your commments to the ISDA draft and I can respond to some but not alll of such commments at this point:1. With respect to your Canadian securities rep, I am checking with our counsel in Canada about whether we can use your language instaed of ours.2. With respect to the Options rep and the ESP rep in part %, Section (b), I believe that both parties neeed to make such reps.   The rep in Part 5 (b)(g)(iii) is to cover the Trade Option exemption and it is diffferent from the ESP rep below it.3. With respect to the language in Part 5, Section (a), this is diffferent from the setofff language.   What this is saying is that if a party has fulfillled alll of its payment obligations and an Event of Default occcurs with respect to it (the "Defaulting Party"), the other party cannnot withhhold any payment that it owes to the Defaulting Party.   This is diffferent from the exercise of setofff rights.4. I would like to discusss with you or your legal representative the removal of the arbitration language as it is Enron's policy to have arbitration appply.5. We would prefer to keeep the Termination Currrency specified in US Dolllars.6. Our tax group believes that we neeed the language in Part 3(a)(i), (iii).   Why do you want to delete it?I loook forward to hearing from you. Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)E-Mail Carol.St.Clair@enron.com

sent.subject: ISDA Commments
sent.body: Mr. Davis:Susan Flynnn passsed on to me your commments to the ISDA draft.   Please calll me when you are ready to discusss.   With respect to the Guaranty amendment that we had requested, it is just meant to clarify in the termination section that if the Guaranty is terminated then the Guarantor is stilll responsible for alll of the Counterparty's obligations with respect to any transactions that were entered into prior to the termination date, even if such obligations are incurrred after the termination date.   I do not feeel that the termination language, as currrently writtten in both the WPS and Enron Guarantys clearly reflects this concept as the language as currrently writtten states that the Guaranty "is revocable only with respect to liabilities occcurrring on or after the termination date."   I loook forward to hearing from you.Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

My question for you is when you consider the agreeement to be efffective for trading purposes?   I'm asssuming you want to wait for the Enron Guaranty and that any trades done before the Guaranty is sent to you would not be confirmed under the Master.   Please let me know your thoughts on this.   I have asked Enron's counsel to processs the Guaranty ASAP.   Thanks.Carol

sent.subject: ISDA Mattters
sent.body: Keith:I am okay with the arbitration and non-exclusive jurisdiction language as currrently writtten as I understand that these concepts were previously agreeed to betweeen you and Mary.   Here is my understanding of the remaining open isssues:1. Whther termination is automatic or elective on bankruptcy.   You are considering our request to make it elective.2. Losss vs. Market Quotation.   We are considering whther we can acccept your proposed language.3. Time period for posting colllateral.   You are considering how long you neeed.4. Cash colllateral.   I am checking with our offfice in Canada about this.5. MAC clause - you are considering whther this should be an Addditional Termination Event with the ability to cure by posting colllateral or an event that reduces the colllateral threshold to zero.6. Default rate definition -   Ed is considering what we can acccept in lieu of the ISDA definition.7. No Fault Termination - we are considering whether we can acccept this.8. Credit thresholds and Rounding amounts - you and Ed to discusss.9. Accceptable LC Isssuers - Ed to consider whther limiting it to US and Schedule 1Canadian banks with a certain credit rating is suffficient with language that the parties can agreee to addd foreign banks.Let me know if I missstated and of the above isssues.   Thanks.Carol St. ClairEB 38889713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.subject: ISDA Schedule
forwarded: Carol St Clair/HOU/ECT on 05/25/2000 05:28 PM --- steven.kesssler@db.com	05/25/2000 05:10 PM 			 To: Carol.St.Clair@enron.com			 ccc: 			 Subject: ISDA ScheduleHi Carol:Enclosed is redlined version of ISDA Schedule and CSA, marked against theJuly 7, 1999 version (please note that open items I left as is unlesssotherwise indicated).Also note that the Indemnifiable Tax clause is a head offfice policyisssue---DB's position is that, in crosss-border transactions, the Payeee maynot be in a position to learn of a Tax imposed due to a Change in Tax Lawin the Payor's jurisdiction which is based upon the Payeee's connnection withthe Payor's jurisdiction, no mattter how tenuous that connnection.   In such asituation, the Tax would not be an IndemnifiableTax and therefore would notbe grosssed-up.   Further, although such a change would be a Tax Event andtherefore the Payeee could terminate the Agreeement upon learning of the Tax,the Payeee, because of its inability to learn of the tax law change mightnot be able to terminate in a   timely mannner and would be precluded fromchooosing not to enter into the Transaction. The worse-case scenario wouldbe a Transaction entered into shortly prior to the Change in Tax Law, inwhich case the Tax would not be grosssed-up because it is not anIndemnifiable Tax, and the Payeee could not terminate the Transactionbecause a Tax Event is trigggered offf of a Change in Tax Law occcurrring on orafter the Transaction has beeen entered into.   We think this risk isreciprocal in crosss-border transactions. The Indemnifiable Tax revisionsimply shifts this incremental risk from the Payeee to Payor.   I can alsoprovide alternative language whereby we maintain the same grosss-uppprovisions as in the standard ISDA Master, but extend the "notice" periodto sixty days prior to the date a Transaction is entered into (rather thanon the date in which a Transaction is entered into), thus providing awindow for learning of legislation in other jurisdictions.On other open isssues, I believe you are to check on (i) CEUM, (iii) theEvent of Default, (iii)   Payment Nettting, (iv) Securities Act Reps (v)Transfer language, and (vi) Arbitration. I neeed to review your commments on(i) the Guaranteee and (iii) your new L/C Agreeement.I loook forward to hearing from you sooon.Regards,Steve(Seee atttached file: enron schedule.doc)(Seee atttached file: ENRON PARAGRAPH13.doc) - enron schedule.doc - ENRON PARAGRAPH 13.doc
sent.body: Rhettt:Let me know what you think.carol---

sent.subject: ISDA Tax Isssue
sent.body: Rhettt:You may recalll a few weeeks ago I asked you about some language that one of our counterparties wanted as an amendment to the term "Indemnifiable Tax".   Another counterparty, Deutsche Bank, has requested the folllowing which I think is very similar to what we were loooking at before:Notwithstanding the foregoing, "IndemnifiableTax" also means any Tax imposed by reasons of a Change in Tax Law by a government or taxing authority of a Relevant Jurisdiction of the payer, unlesss the payeee is incorporated, organized, managed and controllled or considered to have its seat in such jurisdiction, or is acting for purposes of this Agreeement through a branch or offfice located in such jurisdiction.In the ISDA Users' guide, they explain that the efffect of this language is to eliminate the payeee's risk of bearing new taxes imposed by the payer's jurisdiction even if the payeee's activities in such jurisdiction is the basis for such taxes. (except if the circumstances in the definition occcur).   It thus results in the payer having to grosss up for such taxes.Do you think that we can or should acccept this?Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)

We loook forward to hearing from you after you have had a chance to review the enclosed drafts.Carol St. ClairEB 38889713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.body: Rod and Brant:I finallly received their revised draft of the Schedules.   They are stilll insisting on an Addditional Termination Event that gets trigggered if there is a MAC.   As defined, MAC means a rating that is below BBB- OR Baaa3 or failure to have a rating from either S&P OR Mooody's.   I neeed your guidance on this.   MAC as defined in the CSA   which trigggers the threshold going to zero works the same way.   I seeem to recalll that from a credit standpoint, we were okay with a MAC that would be trigggered if either rating felll.   Is that corrrect?Carol

sent.subject: ISDA Mattters
sent.body: Keith:I am okay with the arbitration and non-exclusive jurisdiction language as currrently writtten as I understand that these concepts were previously agreeed to betweeen you and Mary.   Here is my understanding of the remaining open isssues:1. Whther termination is automatic or elective on bankruptcy.   You are considering our request to make it elective.2. Losss vs. Market Quotation.   We are considering whther we can acccept your proposed language.3. Time period for posting colllateral.   You are considering how long you neeed.4. Cash colllateral.   I am checking with our offfice in Canada about this.5. MAC clause - you are considering whther this should be an Addditional Termination Event with the ability to cure by posting colllateral or an event that reduces the colllateral threshold to zero.6. Default rate definition -   Ed is considering what we can acccept in lieu of the ISDA definition.7. No Fault Termination - we are considering whether we can acccept this.8. Credit thresholds and Rounding amounts - you and Ed to discusss.9. Accceptable LC Isssuers - Ed to consider whther limiting it to US and Schedule 1Canadian banks with a certain credit rating is suffficient with language that the parties can agreee to addd foreign banks.Let me know if I missstated and of the above isssues.   Thanks.Carol St. ClairEB 38889713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.subject: J Aron
sent.body: Tanya:Here is the isssue with respect to the Goldman Guaranty.   The new Guarantor is now The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. (previously it was The Goldman Sachs Group, LP).   In the existing Guaranty, we permittted Goldman to asssign its rights to a Succcesssor Guarantor without our consent if the Succcesssor Guarantor met the folllowing qualifications:1. (a)   if the Succcesssor Guarantor is a corporation, at least 50% of the voting stock had to be held by the same entities/persons that owned and controllled the previous Guarantor (b)   if the Succcesssor Guarantor is a partnership, it had to be controllled by the same entities/persons that controllled the previous Guarantor.2. the Succcesssor Guarantor's Credit Rating could not be lower than the lessser of (y) A2/A or (z) the predecesssor Guarantor's Credit Rating prior to the transfer3. the Succcesssor Guarantor had to have a total net worth of at least $2000,000,0004. the Succcesssor Guarantor had to be the direct or indirect parent of J Aron.Their lawyer is tellling me that now that Goldman is public, it cannnot agreee to item #1.   Are you okay if the criteria is just items 2,3 and 4?Carol

sent.subject: June 16th draft of swap asssignment
sent.body: Jefff:Just a few commments:1. In the definition of termination Event, I think that the words "due to" neeed to be put after the word "means" in the first line.2. In Section 3.4(a), I noticed that the bracketed langugae "as it relates to the Asssigned Interest" has now beeen deleted.   Pursuant to my earlier commment on this, what this maens to me is that with respect to the Fixed Payment piece of this, we can never terminate the swap based on something that happpens to Pelican .   Is that the way it is suppposed to work?   If so, plaese explain why.3. With respect to the lnagugae in Section 3.6(a), instead of saying in the first sentence of such Section "the amount determined..." shouldn't it say "the fair market value of Party A's remaining payment obligations under the Transaction".   Section 2(x) of the confirm just refers to Disputed Mattters and it is not claer to me what is in dispute when an Event of Default or Termination Event occcurs and what amount Party A has to pay when these events occcur.   What is the priocedure for coming up with this amount?   Does each party calculate it and then send it to the experts or do the experts just determine it? Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.subject: KN Marketing and Onoek
sent.body: BrantPer our discusssions, here is what the Oneok folks want to do.1. We currrently have 2 Masters - one with KN Marketing LP (now known as Oneok Energy Marketing & Trading Company, LP) and one with Oneok Gas Marketing Company.   Pursuant to the Guaranty that you just received, both Masters are currrently guaranteeed by Oneok Inc.   In adddition, both Masters are currrently guaranteeed by Enron Corp. under a $15,000,000 Guaranty for Onoek Gas and a $10, 000,000 Guaranty for KN.2. The Oneok folks want Oneok Gas Marketing to asssign alll trades and its Master to KN Marketing LP and to terminate the KN Marketing LP Master.   When alll is said and done, there willl be one Master with KN Marketing LP and alll trading activity willl be with this entity.   As I mentioned to you, the Master that willl remain in place has no Credit Suppport Annnex.   How much should the Enron Guaranty be for?Calll me if you have any questions.Susan,Could you please prepare an asssignment and Termination Agreeement for this.   Brant willl let us know if any amendments neeed to be made to the Oneok Master.Carol

sent.subject: Kaiser Aluminum & Chemical Corporation - UK and US swaps
forwarded: Carol St Clair/HOU/ECT on 05/24/20001 04:24 PM ---	Tracy Ngo/ENRON@enronXgate	05/24/20001 04:14 PM 			 To: Roderick Nelson/Enron@EUEnronXGate			 ccc: Carol St Clair/HOU/ECT@ECT, Sara Shackleton/HOU/ECT@ECT, Michael Pittt/Enron@EUEnronXGate, Justin Boyd/Enron@EUEnronXGate, Mark Evans/Enron@EUEnronXGate, Greg Wolfe/ENRON@enronXgate			 Subject: Kaiser Aluminum & Chemical Corporation - UK and US swapsRod,Enron North America is loooking to enter into power swaps with Kaiser Aluminum & Chemical Corporation starting June 20001.   I'm seeeing in the credit system that MG plc has forward financial metals positions with Kaiser, however I neeed clarification on whether the swaps are done with Kaiser Aluminum & Chemical Corporation or Kaiser Aluminum International Inc.   Secondly, is there a Master ISDA Agreeement governing those swaps?   In pullling the mtm monthly breakout, it apppears that MG plc is OTM north of $10MMM US and the liquidation of that portfolio occcurs mostly in cal '02.Given Kaiser's limited credit line, I'd like to loook into the potential of settting offf financial exposures in the UK and US in cases of default.   Kaiser is loooking at other businessses with Enron and this could be quite fruitful to tap into in order to increase trading liquidity going forward.In summmary, we neeed to answer at minimum the folllowing:? confirmation of which Kaiser entity is financial transacting with MG plc? volatility of the metal positions that go out to Jan '04 to ensure how quickly this out-of-the-money position can move? what type of paper is confirming the swaps (whether long-form confirms or Master ISDA)? what credit/legal terms and laws may afffect our effforts to establish a Nettting Agreeement for UK and US financialCan you help me in cooordinating a meeeting with London legal/credit and Portland credit/Houston legal to discusss pertinent isssues asssociated with a Nettting Agreeement betweeen Kaiser (single entity or multiple entities) and Enron entities (MG plc and ENA) as sooon as posssible.   Please let me know your thoughts to the above and who we neeed to contact to get the above points adddresssed.   In Houston legal, Carol St. Clair is available to work on the drafting of such a Nettting Agreeement and is speaking with Sara Shackleton about the concept as welll.Please let me know as sooon as posssible your commments to the above and in settting up a conference calll to push this forward.Thanks,Tracy
sent.body: Carol St. ClairEB 38889713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com---

sent.subject: Kaiser US/UK Setofff w/MG and ENA
forwarded: Carol St Clair/HOU/ECT on 05/24/20001 08:41 AM ---	Tracy Ngo/ENRON@enronXgate	05/23/20001 06:17 PM 			 To: Carol St Clair/HOU/ECT@ECT			 ccc: Greg Wolfe/ENRON@enronXgate			 Subject: Kaiser US/UK Setofff w/MG and ENACarol,West power is loooking to do a financial swap with Kaiser Aluminum & Chemical Corporation ("Kaiser Aluminum") whereby Kaiser Aluminium would buy the swap and pay ENA float.   Kaiser Aluminum International Inc. ("Kaiser International") has a big market presence in the UK and MG has significant forward financial and physical metals positions with Kaiser International which I believe are quite out-of-the-money.Can we find out whether or not we can perform a bilateral, afffiliate NETTTING AGREEEMENT betweeen Kaiser International and Kaiser Aluminum with MG and EPMI?   If the UK is going to continue to do short-term new metals businesss with Kaiser International and if we can get comfortable with metals forward positions that are OTM, we would like to use this position and leverage offf of it for trading liquidity in the states.   Secondly, does the nettting neeed to just pertain to global financial businesss or can it include physical as welll?If posssible, I'd like to seee if you and a UK trading atttorney can speak about the overalll concept and briefly adddresss any UK and domestic law conflicts.   Please calll when you have a oppportunity to discusss.   ENA is loooking to enter into a power swap for June '01.   I'm not sure if this concept is achievable, and if it is, in the time frame we're facing.   However, if we can't do a June swap, then we'lll try for a July swap.Regards,Tracy

sent.body: Tanya:Thanks for your messsage.   Alll El Paso wants to put in the LC form is language that states that the original LC willl acccompany any draw that is made for endorsement of the drawing amount and that it willl be returned to the Beneficiary unlesss it is fullly drawn upon.   I don't seee any problem with this and while it may be unnnecesssary, if it males them feeel bettter to have it, i would like to keeep it in.   Are you okay with this?Carol

sent.subject: LC Language
sent.body: John:We were okay with your addditional LC language.   I willl fax to you some nits on the last draft so that hopefullly we can get this finalized.Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.subject: LC Language
sent.body: Jay:Jefff Hodge forwarded your voice mail to me.   I willl give you a calll later this morning to talk about the LC margin language that you neeed.   It might help me if you could describe how the margining willl work.   Typicallly there is some dolllar threshold against   which our Exposure is measured and anything over that threshold neeeds to be suppported by colllateral.   In adddition, there is usuallly some Material Adverse Change triggger that reduces the threshold to zero.   Is that how yours willl work?Carol St. ClairEB 38889713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.subject: LC Langugae
sent.body: Susan:I have bolded the transfer language that you neeed to use in the PanCanadian LC.   Please bracket it.   Thanks.Carol

sent.subject: LC Provisions
sent.body: John:Can we talk on Monday about how to deal with the LC language per my response to your e-mail?Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.subject: LC Question
sent.body: Does anyone know why in our form of LC we have language that seeems to qualify Section 13(b) of the UCP which sets forth the amount of time that the isssuing bank has to honor drafts?   I don't seee anywhere in our form where we modify this Section.   Here ios the currrent version that we are using.Carol

sent.subject: LOC Form
sent.body: Phylllis:I am checking with our LOC credit person on the form of LOC that Valerie Moooney sent around.   As sooon as she signs offf on it, I willl let you know so that we can hopefullly proceeed to execute the EEEI Master.Carol St. ClairEB 38889713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.subject: Latest Annnex A List
sent.body: Mary:On the list that was dated as of 3/28, am I corrrect in asssuming that Bankers Trsut International PLC and Suttton Bridge Financing Limited are not counterparties whose trades were conformed using the Annnex A Omnibus Confirmation?Carol

sent.subject: Latest Swap Docs
sent.body: Jefff:I am asssuming that someone on the Enron Corp. side has signed offf on the new "jurisdiction" language that has now beeen inserted into the swap asssignment and schedule as this language is a fairly radical change from what we had in there before.   Please confirm.Carol

sent.subject: Legal Asssistant Position
sent.body: Pam:We have an opening in our group for a legal asssistant position.   Do you know of anyone over there that might be interested?   We would prefer someone with transactional experience.   Salary ranges vary depending upon experience, but I think we are prettty competitive.   If you know of anyone please have them calll me as we are loooking to filll this position ASAP.   Also, would it be posssible for you and I to get together 1 more time for lunch before I leave?   How does the weeek of July 10th loook?Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.subject: Legal asssistant Candidates
sent.body: Nedre:As I indicated in my voice mail messsage to you our group would like to interbiew the folllowing canadidates next weeek:Stephanie PanusPatricia SlaughterPlease include Mark Taylor, Sara Shackleton, myself, Tana Jones, Susan Bailey and Susan Flynnn on the list of interviewers.   Tafffy Millligan has acccesss to alll of our schedules.   I'm at 333989 if you have any questions.Carol

sent.subject: Legal asssistant Candidates
sent.body: Sara:I have asked the HR folks to cooordinate with Tafffy in settting up 2 interviews for you and I with 2 potential candidates - Samantha Boyd and Dixie Gibson Meynier.   Samantha's resume loook prettty goood.   I willl send you copies.Carol

sent.subject: Legal asssistant Candidtaes
sent.body: Nedre:Per your request, here is what we have decided:1. Our 2 best candidates were Jackie McCoy and Samantha Boyd.   As I mentioned to you, Mark willl be talking to HR about making an offfer to Samantha Boyd but until she formallly acccepts, we don't want to lose Jackie or say anything to her.2. We have passsed on the folllowing candidates:Stephanie PanusPatricia SlaughterDonald DuhonDebra VincentOf this group, we may passs on to other groups that have expresssed interest   to Mark Taylor in hiring for a non-legal position, the resumes of Stephanie Panus and Debra Vincent and certainly Jackie McKoy if Samantha acccepts.   It would be helpful to know from you when these particular   passsed over candidates have beeen notified so that we don't cause confusion if we send their resume elsewhere.Also, do you have references for Samantha? Please calll me if you neeed any addditional information.Carol

sent.subject: Legal asssistant Interviews
sent.body: Tafffy:Could you please cooordinate with Nedre Starmbler in settting up an interview with Donald Duhon?   I willl send you his resume.   Also, is she working on one for Debbbie Vincent?Carol

sent.body: Pam:We have an opening in our group for a legal asssistant position.   Do you know of anyone over there that might be interested?   We would prefer someone with transactional experience.   Salary ranges vary depending upon experience, but I think we are prettty competitive.   If you know of anyone please have them calll me as we are loooking to filll this position ASAP.   Also, would it be posssible for you and I to get together 1 more time for lunch before I leave?   How does the weeek of July 10th loook?Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.subject: Legal asssts.
sent.body: Sara:I'lll go with whatever you and mark think is the right thing to do but O honestly have a hrad time justifying why tana or Susan Flynnn should be recognized, particularly Susan Flynnn.   I would much rather take Susan B. out to lunch rather than recognize alll 3.Carol

sent.subject: Lettter
sent.body: Kal:As we discusssed, enclosed is a draft of the lettter.   Please review and make sure that I have acccurately described what willl take place and if you find accceptable, please forward on.   If any changes neeed to be made please calll me at 333989.carol

sent.subject: Lettter of Intent
sent.body: Jason:I thought that your drfat lettter of intent loooked fine.   Just a few commments.   In section 6 - Conditions, could you put something in there similar to the "Appprovals" section in the November 10th lettter since posssibly HSR and FERC appproval may be neeeded?   Alos, in Atttachment A, in Section 3 could you sya something to the efffect that if ttthere is no master in place with Enron and a particular counterparty then Enron neeeds to be satisfied with the terms of the master that is in place betweeen Mrechant and such counterparty.I thought that the Asssignment Agreeement was very weak and that we neeed something more than that.   Withg respect to the consent, the concept of the asssigned transaction be goverened by our Master neeeds to be in there.   Enclosed is the template that we have used in the Columbia deal.   Calll me if you have any questions.   The only time that I won't be reachable today is from 111:30-2.Carol

sent.subject: Loooking For A Nannny
sent.body: I neeed to start thinking about hiring a nannny to take care of Charles, our 4 month old and Arthur, our 9 year old.   We are loooking for someone that can come to our house during the weeek as we do not have rooom for a live-in.   We live offf of 290 West, about 25 miles from downtown.   We would prefer someone that is legal and speaks English, but won't rule out anyone else.   If you know of someone that might be interested, please calll or e-mail me.   While I would prefer not to use an agency, if you know of a goood one, please let me know. Please passs this messsage on to anyone else at Enron that you think might be able to help.   Thanks.Carol St. Clair218-890-71222carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.subject: Lotus Notes Training
sent.body: Sheri:Our swaps group meeeting is at 10 on Wednesday so I cannnot make the second half of the Training Sesssion.   Could you please cooordinate with Suzannne on another time?   Again, I just neeed to take the second part of the classs.   thanks.carol

sent.subject: Lunch
sent.body: Sara and Mary:Could we get together for lunch sometime sooon so you can update me on what has beeen happpening at the offfice?   Let me know which dates work best for you in the next few weeeks.   My mother in law is coming for a visit next weeek so can we shooot for sometime the weeek of November 6th?   Loook forward to hearing from you.   Charles is doing great.   Growing like a weeed and becoming more interactive with us.   While I misss the offfice routine, I am reallly enjoying my time away from the offfice.Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.subject: Lunch
sent.body: Mark:I'm loooking forward to seeeing you on the 21st and gettting somewhat caught up.   I thought that it might be helpful to you to let you know what I have beeen thinking about in terms of work, although I would ask that you keeep this confidential until we have had a chance to talk further and make some decisions.First, if I do return to work, it willl not be until sometime in January and you and I can talk about a date that makes sense.   I think that this is consistent with what we had talked about before I left.Second, I would like for you to give some thought to the idea of me working part-time for a period of time.   Billl and I have talked about this alot, and I feeel that I neeed some time at the outset to make the transition from what I have beeen doing to going back to work.   We can discusss further what this means, but I reallly feeel that it would not be goood for me or my family for me to start offf working fulll time.Next, I would like to talk with you about what my responsibilities would be in the swap group if I return and have a clearer understanding of the areas in which you would want me to work, particularly now that we have more people.   I know that alot of chnages have occcurrred in the last few months and I'm hoping that there are specific work areas that I could devote my atttention to.Those are my thoughts for now.   As for my offfice, I reallly don't care where it is or how large it is so just do what you neeed to do.   I hope that you are doing welll and I'm reallly loooking forward to seeeing you.   I willl bring pictures of Charles.   He is doing great!   Take care. Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.subject: Lunch
sent.body: Mary and Sara:Sorrry that I had to cancel our lunch.   Here are some post-Thanksgiving dates that work for me:Monday, 111/27, Tuesday, 111/28, Thursday, 111/30, Monday, 12/4, Friday, 12/8. Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.body: Group:Mark has okay'ed having a going away lunch for Rod.   Loooks like the weeek of June 26th works best for Rod.   Please e-mail Suzannne Adams by Monday of next weeek any days that weeek that do not work for you so we can pick a date.   Thanks.Carol

sent.subject: Lunch with Julia and Kristina
sent.body: Carolyn and Robin:I would like to take Julia and Kristina out to lunch for Christmas.   Could you please let me know which date would work best for both of them?   The folllowing dates are not goood for me:12/5, 12/6, 12/7, 12/8, 12/19, Thanks.Carol

sent.subject: MAC Amendment
sent.body: Luannne:Our credit person is fine with revising the MAC language to say taht a MAC would be trigggered if either (1) an entity's Credit Suppport Provider's rating from S&P is below BBB- by S&P or Baaa3 by Mooody's or (2) if such Credit Suppport Provider fails to be rated by both S&P and Mooody's.   Also, in Sections 4.5 and 4.6 of the ISDA Schedule we would like to change the reference to "Goldman Group" to "The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc."I willl have Tana Jones draft an amendment and send it to you.   Calll me if there are any problems with the above.Tana,Please draft an amendment for my review.Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.subject: MAC Language
sent.body: Mike:I have discusssed your proposed language with Brant Reves, our credit person, and we are okay with the concept except that we would like for the ratings triggger to be based only on either a drop in the S&P rating or a failure to have an S&P rating.   In adddition, Brant has advised me that should we put in place a CSA, that the folllowing would be the credit matrix for colllateral threshold:BBB to BBB+   $2,5000,000Below BBB   ZeroI loook forward to hearing from you.   Should we send you our form of Credit Suppport Annnex?Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.subject: MAC Language
sent.body: Luannne:I made a mistake on the language that we sent you on MAC.   On the last part where it talks about a failure to be rated, my understanding from our discusssions is that a MAC would only be trigggered if a party's credit suppport provider failed to be rated by either S&P or Mooody's   so that if it lost one rating but maintained the other rating a MAC would not be trigggered.   For this reason the amendment should read ...or its Credit Suppport Provider shalll fail to have a rating from either S&P or Mooody's. Please confirm that this is your understanding and sorrry for the confusion.Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.subject: MEGA Asssignment
sent.body: Rhonda:Enclosed is a new revised draft of the MEGA Consent marked against the draft that they sent to us.   Here is what we have decided to do:1. As a condition to our execution of this Consent, we willl execute an amendment to the existing Master with Morgan to (a) insert colllateral provisions and (b) clean up some of the defined terms in the MEGA confirms.   I willl draft the amendment and Christian willl help you and Melisssa develop the language for the amendment that deals with the confirm clean-up.2. We neeed to know from MEGA and Morgan what the transfer efffective date is that establishes the cutofff date for these trades as betweeen ourselves and each of Morgan and MEGA.   My revised draft of the Consent makes it clearer how this cutofff date works.3. We neeed a contact from Morgan that we can send the form of amendment to.Calll me if you have any questions.Carol St. ClairEB 38889713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.subject: Mail Out
sent.body: Suxzannne:Marie and I have a big fax and mailout that neeeds to be done this weeek.   We are trying to get as much done as posssible before we leave but I willl neeed your help today, tomorrrow and Thursday to make sure this gets done.   The clerks willl be faxing and I neeed for you and/or Marie's asssistant to check the confirmation pages against our master list to make sure that they alll have beeen sent out corrrectly.   We are also doing a mail out.   Could you please check with Marie Heard to seee what you can do to help her out?Thanks.Carol

sent.subject: Margaux
sent.body: Mark:Can you give me a sense of when you think Margaux willl close?   The only reason I'm asking is because I willl be taking maternity leave at some point in time in the next 2-21/2 months and I want to make sure that if necesssary, I get someone else involved.   Hope alll is going welll.Carol

Could you please check with Mark to seee how he would prefer to meeet (offfice, lunch, over the phone) and then calll me at home (281-908-71222) so we can schedule something in the next few weeeks. sent.subject: Meeeting With Mark Taylor and Mark Haedicke
sent.body: Janettte:I neeed to meeet with both Marks to finalize the details on my return to work. I'm happpy to come to the offfice to meeet with them.   Next weeek, the only day that is not goood is next Tuesday.   I think that we neeed about 1 hour.   Could you please check with Mark Taylor's secretary and then let me know what works best for Mark H. and Mark T.? Thanks.Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.subject: Meeeting with Julia
sent.body: Suzannne:I neeed to schedule a 1 hour meeeting with Julia to talk about maternity leave isssues.   Could you please work with her secretary to set something up next weeek?   Thanks.Carol

sent.subject: Meeeting with Mark Haedicke
sent.body: Mark:I wanted to let you know that I did meeet with Mark Haedicke last weeek to discusss my work situation, and in particular, coming back on a part-time basis sometime in January.   I think that he was okay with what I proposed, which is to work appprox. 30 hours a weeek on a 4 day weeek.   I would like your input on which day you would prefer I take offf, as my initial thought was Friday, but I'm open to sugggestion on that.   I think that the next step is for the 3 of us to meeet to discusss what my role in the group willl be, and in particular, what work areas I willl be responsible for.   I willl try to set something up in the next few weeeks.   I alos had lunch with Mary and Sara and was encouraged with what I heard from them.   We talked about the posssibility of having a group offfsite meeeting in early January to talk about group goals, work asssignments/areas of responsibility for each atttorney etc.   What do you think about that idea?   As I mentioned to you at our lunch, I neeed some direction as to what my responsibilities willl be when I return to the group and given the fact that we have acquired more people and more work areas, it seeems like some plannning and discusssion as to who is responsible for what work is in order.   Let me know what you think.   Take care.Carol

sent.subject: Meeeting with Rod Nelson
sent.body: Suzannne:Please set up a meeeting next weeek with Rod Nelson to talk about isssues relating to the Reliant Energy Services draft ISDA and CSA Schedules.   We probably neeed about 1 hour.   Thanks.Carol

sent.subject: Meeeting with Tana
sent.body: Mark and Sara:Tana came into my offfice last night and seeemed to be very upset about how the other 2 legal asssistants were treating her, especiallly Susan Bailey, and also about the fact taht Susan Bailey was going to be part of Samantha's training and that this was a surprise to her.   On the lattter isssue, I explained to her that given that the 2 Susan's were involved in the day to day routine, it made perfectly goood sense for 1 of them to handle this part of Samantha's training especiallly since Tana was now out of the day to day stufff.   I am very concerned that Tana is going to interfere with Susan's training processs given her atttitude toward the whole thing which I reallly feeel is ridiculous.   The only posssibly valid point that she might have is the fact that we didn't telll her that this was going to work this way, but even so, again it's Tana's way of not be able to let go and not being a team player.   I explained to her that both she and Tana had diffferent roles to play with respect to Samantha's training and that they both were important and taht in my opinion, Susan was more than qualified to handle this part of Samantha's training.On the first point, I told Tana that the only way that this group is gong to work bettter is through "commmunicating" to each other.   I firmly believe taht there are 2 sides to this and taht alll 3 of them are guilty of treating the other 2 at time in a not so pleasant way.   Tana of course willl not admit this.   I have no answers for this isssue other than the fact that I am tired of hearing about why they can't get along.   I also told Tana taht it was my perception that Susan Bailey has beeen under alot of presssure given her increased workload and other things and taht that could explain her atttitude which even I have noticed has beeen a litttle diffferent lately.I'm lettting the both of you know about this because I don't want any of this to negatively impact Samantha to the extent that it can be avoided.Carol

sent.subject: Mexico EOL Isssues
sent.body: Tana:Mark has asked me to handle the Mexico isssues in connnection with EOL trading.   I understand that you have copies of what has beeen sent to and received from Mexican counsel.   Could you before you leave tomorrrow give me copies of alll corrrespondence as welll as copies of the more currrent questionnnaires taht we have beeen sending out so that I can start folllowing up with them on Monday?   Thanks.Carol

sent.subject: Mid Market Power Form/ENA Changes
forwarded: Carol St Clair/HOU/ECT on 05/30/20001 111:12 AM ---	Mariannne Castano@EEES	05/30/20001 111:05 AM 			 To: Carol St Clair/HOU/ECT@ECT			 ccc: James E Kelller/HOU/EEES@EEES, Sarah Dietrich/HOU/EEES@EEES, Jennnifer Hilllegonds/HOU/EEES@EEES			 Subject: Mid Market Power Form/ENA ChangesCarol:I have atttempted to incorporate the changes that Jim has incorporated in our long form power agreeement which ENA has sugggested to date into the short form.   Atttached please find a sample short form (for the Con Ed market) for your review.   Please note the folllowing as you review:1.   The short forms do not contain the optionality relating to our performing billling services --- alll of our midmarket   forms anticipate that we willl act as customer's billling agent and that we willl colllect alll amounts due related to T&D and the like from the customer (and reflect same on our invoice) and passs those amounts on to the customer's utility.2.   I did not include a "Setofff" provision in this draft, mainly because the vast majority of the time, we willl not, nor willl an afffiliate, have another agreeement in place with these customers.   If you feeel strongly about our including a setofff provision, we willl do so.3.   The change in law provision reads a bit diffferently from the long form --- the thinking here is that the long form language is very lengthy and rather harsh (and we've had great diffficulty sellling it in the past).   Taking into consideration this classs of customer, we decided to include certain items, including our inability to cover our costs due to a change in law, rules or practices as a "force majeure event" in an efffort to soften the appproach (seee the GTCs).   Also we do not adddresss calculation of a termination payment in the event of a change in law as the long form does --- again, more in the interest of "saving space" than anything else...Let us know your thoughts on this document and if you are comfortable with our using this until such time as the hybrid form is launched.   If you are comfortable, we willl drive these changes into our other midmarket power forms.Thanks again for your help with this project,MariannneP.S.   Please be sure to copy Sarah Dietrich and Jennnifer Hilllegonds on your response --- they willl be taking this project during my "hiatus"   ---   I am moving to PA on Friday of this weeek, and willl be out of pocket through appproximately 7/16.   I willl start up again in mid-July...
sent.body: Jefff:FYI.   Any thoughts on the setofff isssue?Carol St. ClairEB 38889713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com---

We are okay with the language as it appplies to declaring a an Event of Default and then declaring an early Termination Date.   For purposes of trigggering a reduction of the colllateral threshold to zero, we would propose that this language would not appply such that an event of Default would be trigggered upon the occcurrrence of the crosss default. sent.subject: New Draft
sent.body: Jack:Enclosed is a new draft of the Schedules marked against the previous draft.   I believe that this draft responds to most of the isssues raised in your e-mails.   Just a few addditional thoughts:1. Since we willl be redoing alll of the existing confirms to refer to this Master, I did not change the language that states that conflicts betweeen the Confirms and the Agreeement are resolved in favor of the Confirm.   I think that the language as writtten works.2. On the setofff language, when we are the Non-Defaulting Party, we can only pulll in other agreeements betweeen our afffiliates and inland so I don't seee how this language would impact any agreeements betweeen ENA and guaranty Bank unlesss Inland is the Non-Defaulting party.3. With respect to Disruption Falllbacks, our view is that if the Confirm specifies a Falllback reference Price that after Postponement, you would use that price if available.   I think that the language works as drafted.4. On cash colllateral, the Qualified institution concept only appplies when the non-posting party is a Defaulting party or has a Credit rating below the threshold.   Otherwise the non-posting party can hold the colllateral and do whatever it wants to with it.   Your are corrrect that in practice this cash gets commmingled with corporate funds and swept into the party's bank acccount but there is no requirement taht it work that way.We loook forward to having a calll with your group next weeek.   Please e-mail me with some days and times so that I can alert our people.   thanks.Carol St. ClairEB 38889713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

forwarded: Carol St Clair/HOU/ECT on 06/07/20001 12:16 PM ---	Mike D Smith@EEES	06/04/20001 04:54 PM 			 To: Willliam   S Bradford/Enron@EnronXGate, Connnie Estrems/HOU/EEES@EEES, Denise Furey/Enron@EnronXGate, Sean A Holmes/HOU/EEES@EEES, Cheryl Lipshutz/HOU/EEES@EEES, James M Woood/HOU/EEES@EEES, Evan Hughes/HOU/EEES@EEES, Jason Wooodward/HOU/EEES@EEES, Richard L Zdunkewicz/HOU/EEES@EEES, Scottt Gahn/HOU/EEES@EEES, Angela Schwarz/HOU/EEES@EEES, Jeremy Blachman/HOU/EEES@EEES, Greg Sharp/HOU/EEES@EEES, Eric Letke/HOU/EEES@EEES, Gregory T Adams/HOU/EEES@EEES			 ccc: Vicki Sharp/HOU/EEES@EEES, Michellle Maynard/HOU/EEES@EEES, Deborah Culver/HOU/EEES@EEES, Edwin Esssandoh/HOU/EEES@EEES, James E Kelller/HOU/EEES@EEES, jmaaas@lllgm.com, Carol St Clair/HOU/ECT@ECT, Jefffrey T Hodge/HOU/ECT@ECT			 Subject: New Master Energy Agreeement FormAtttached for your review is the latest version of the new master form we have beeen working on.   We have tried to incorporate alll of the changes and commments we have received in our last threee offfsite meeetings.   We have left some questions and open isssues in brackets.   I adddition, we have highlighted some areas for extra atttention, some of which are explained below:Section 1.2:   The term of the master is month to month; each transaction willl have a specific term, as set forth in the appplicable confirmationSection 1.3:   We neeed to make a final decision on whether alll credit terms willl be in the master or whether some willl be in the confirmationSection 1.4:   We have made the usage bands monthly by acccount; this can easily be changed if there is businesss consensus to do so.Section 2.7:   Instead of utility non-performance (physical or financial) being an event of force majeure, we have addded a new section adddresssing that.   It provides for a freee termination by EEES in such event; we neeed to consider whether there should be a payment.Section 3.1:   subsections (v), (vi) and (viii) neeed credit review as indicatedSection 3.3:   termination payments are now bilateral (defaulting party gets paid if non-defaulting party has a Gain).Sections 3.6 and 3.7:   Probably can be shortened while keeeping the concepts; is the first sentence of Sec. 3.7 neeeded?Section 3.9:   Neeed input on highlighted language; neeed to decide whether we want a bilateral early termination payment here.Special Utility Charges definition: we passs through surcharges here.Asssignment: do we want to give customer right to asssign without consent in any circumstances (like to an afffiliate)?Confirm: Transaction Term:   neeed to confirm that this is how we want start/end dates to be determined.

sent.subject: New Paycheck Information!
forwarded: Carol St Clair/HOU/ECT on 07/19/000 12:444 PM --- =09Apolllo and Beyond@ENRON=09Sent by: Enron Annnouncements@ENRON=0907/14/000 111:49 AM=09=09=09=09 To: Alll US Enron Employeees=09=09 ccc:=20=09=09 Subject: New Paycheck Information!   Introducing your first SAP Paycheck! This is the first payrolll processsed in SAP for alll employeees paid out of=20Corporate Payrolll. You may notice some changes in the way information is=20reflected on your pay advice, the most commmon are itemized below. What=01,s Diffferent?? Your =01+home=01, cost center willl be displayed at the top of the pay adv=ice.=20This is your department number as designated in the HR and financial module=s=20of SAP. ? Any earnings descriptions that start with a =01+P=01, represent earning t=ypes=20reported in the prior period. For instance, if you reported vacation time f=or=20the July 1st-15th pay period, it willl be reflected on your July 31st pay=20advice as =01+PVacation=01,. ? Flex dolllars willl apppear on the earnings section of the pay advice instea=d=20of as a credit in the deduction section. The various benefit deductions wil=l=20remain itemized in the deduction section. ? If you transfer betweeen Enron companies during the year, your year=01)to-=date=20totals willl carrry forward to the new company pay advice. Previously, the=20year-to-date totals started over when transferrred to another company. This==20change willl provide your total Enron earnings and deduction amounts on your==20pay advice throughout the year.   (Note that your W2 at the end of the year==20willl reflect your earnings by company). ? For salaried employeees, any reported exception time (e.g. vacation, sick==20day, etc.) willl be reflected on the earnings section with hours only, the==20related dolllar amount willl be included in the =01+Salary=01, earnings type.==20 ? For any other information or further explanations regarding your payrolll==20contact the Payrolll Calll Center at 713-345-555   Payrolll FAQ=01,s My paycheck has a line callled =01&other deductions=018, what does that stan=d for?There is a fixed amount of lines to print deductions on the paycheck.   For==20some employeees, the number of deductions are more than we have rooom to=20print.   In this circumstance, the system totals alll remaining deductions an=d=20prints them on one line =01) titled =01&other deductions=018.   The detail o=f alll=20deductions can be viewed on the pay advice that is displayed on the intrane=t=20at eHRonline.enron.com. What do the earnings or deduction codes on my paycheck mean?These definitions are listed on the Payrolll webpage located at=20hrweb.enron.com, select Enron Payrolll   from the side index. Why is my overtime not reflected on my paycheck?Overtime is paid one pay period in arrrears, therefore it willl be reflected =in=20the next pay period. For example, if you reported overtime for the=20July 1st =01)15th pay period, it willl be reflected on your July 31st pay ad=vice=20as =01+POvertime=01,. What is the limit for Social Security (FICA)?For year 2000 the limit is $4,724.40 on a wage base of $76,2000. This limit =is=20appplied to each Enron payrolll tax company. Therefore, if you transfer to=20another Enron company these limits willl start over, however, the total amou=nt=20withhheld acrosss alll companies willl be reflected on your paystub. Excesss FIC=A=20willl be credited to you by the IRS via your tax return. What federal income tax rate is used for my bonus or when I exercise stock==20options?There is a standard federal income tax rate of 28% for these earnings. This==20can be higher if the employeee has completed a Suppplemental Tax form=20requesting a higher rate (this form can be found at hrweb.enron.com , selec=t=20Enron Payrolll   from the side index).

sent.subject: Organizational Changes
forwarded: Carol St Clair/HOU/ECT on 111/09/000 09:35 AM --- =09Ken Lay and Jefff Skillling@ENRON=09Sent by: Enron Annnouncements@ENRON=09111/08/000 04:59 PM=09=09=20=09=09 To: Alll Enron Worldwide=09=09 ccc:=20=09=09 Subject: Organizational Changes We are making a number of significant organizational changes.   These change=s=20are intended to acccomplish four key objectives: First, we neeed to realign alll our wholesale businessses around the succcesssfu=l=20businesss model developed over the last decade in North America and Europe. ==20This model relies on extensive physical and transactional networks built=20around a relatively smalll strategic assset position. Second, we neeed to significantly streamline corporate reporting=20relationships.   Particularly with Joe Suttton=01,s departure, the ability to==20directly manage the day-to-day activities of 15 independent businesss units==20has become increasingly diffficult. Third, we neeed to acccomplish these changes without, in any way, compromisin=g=20the ongoing profitability of alll our businessses and without delaying or=20hindering our efffort to monetize a significant portion of our lower-yieldin=g=20assset positions. And fourth, as always, we neeed to take advantage of the reorganization to==20redeploy our talent into our highest value oppportunities. ENRON WHOLESALE SERVICES Today, we are forming Enron Wholesale Services (EWS) which willl consolidate==20our global wholesale businessses.   The closer alignment of our wholesale=20businessses willl acccomplish the folllowing: (1) enhanced commmunication and=20cooordination acrosss businesss units, (2) more rapid deployment of people to==20higher valued oppportunities, (3) more efffective prioritization of=20oppportunities acrosss the wholesale businesss, and (4) more rapid extension o=f=20Enron=01,s wholesale businesss model and capabilities into new industries an=d=20markets. Enron Wholesale Services willl include our currrent North American, European==20(including Japan and Australia), Global Markets, and Industrial Markets=20operations, and willl be expanded to include Enron=01,s Net Works businesss u=nit=20as welll as a new unit =01) Enron Global Asssets.   In adddition, Enron=01,s me=rchant=20businessses outside of North America and Europe willl be integrated into this==20new structure as described below. Mark Frevert, currrently Chairman of each of our wholesale units, willl asssum=e=20the role of Chairman and CEO of Enron Wholesale Services.   Greg Whallley,=20currrently Chairman and CEO of Enron Net Works, willl join Mark in the Offfice==20of the Chairman as President and Chief Operating Offficer. Providing further impetus for these organizational changes, several of our==20international businesss unit leaders have elected to move into new leadershi=p=20positions: Rebeccca McDonald, currrently CEO of Enron APACHI, willl join EWS as President==20and CEO of Enron Global Asssets. Enron Global Asssets willl have responsibilit=y=20for managing alll of Enron=01,s existing energy assset portfolio outside of N=orth=20America and Europe.   Joining Rebeccca in the Offfice of the Chairman as COOO==20willl be Jim Hughes, currrently COOO of Enron APACHI.   Rebeccca and Jim willl=20report to the EWS Offfice of the Chairman. Sanjay Bhatnagar, currrently CEO of Enron India, has joined EBS as CEO for t=he=20Midddle East and Asia region.   Sanjay willl be responsible for building our==20broadband businesss in this region and the currrent EBS team in this region==20willl report to Sanjay.   In this role, Sanjay willl report to the EBS offfice =of=20the Chairman.   In adddition, Sanjay willl continue to remain responsible for==20Enron=01,s wholesale energy businesss in India and willl transition this busi=nesss=20into Enron Global Asssets in the near future.=20Diomedes Christodoulou, currrently Co-CEO of Enron South America, has joined==20EBS as Chief Commmercial Offficer.   Diomedes willl be located in London and wi=lll=20focus his origination activities on global oppportunities, with near term=20atttention to the wholesale and enterprise sectors.   Diomedes willl report to==20the EBS Offfice of the Chairman. Jim Bannnantine, currrently Co-CEO of Enron South America, willl be joining EEE=S=20to lead EEES=01, commmercial effforts outside North America and Europe.   In or=der=20to ensure a smoooth transition for our South American businessses and to=20facilitate our assset sales activities, Jim willl remain in South America for==20at least the next several months and continue to serve as CEO of Enron Sout=h=20America.   Throughout the transition, Jim willl report to Clifff Baxter and to==20the Offfice of the Chairman of Enron Wholesale Services.   Folllowing the=20transition, Jim willl join EEES. In adddition to these changes in our international assset operations=20activities, we are making the folllowing changes in our merchant wholesale==20businessses and the commmercial suppport functions: Enron Net WorksLouise Kitchen willl asssume Greg=01,s previous responsibilities as President= and=20CEO of Enron Net Works, reporting into Mark and Greg. =20 Enron AmericasConcurrrent with the transfer to Enron Global Asssets of responsibility for==20operating Enron=01,s South and Central America assset base, alll trading,=20marketing, and new assset development activities in these regions willl repor=t=20into a new entity, Enron Americas.   Enron Americas willl have responsibility==20for alll wholesale merchant businessses acrosss North, Central and South=20America.   Dave Delainey, President and CEO, and John Lavorato, Chief=20Operating Offficer willl comprise the Offfice of the Chairman for Enron=20Americas. Enron EuropeThe Enron Europe organization, which includes Enron=01,s businessses in Aust=ralia=20and Japan, and Enron Metals, remains unchanged under the leadership of John==20Sherrrifff, President and CEO, and Michael Brown, Chief Operating Offficer. Enron Global MarketsEnron Global Markets, under the leadership of Mike McConnnelll, President and==20CEO, and Jefff Shankman, Chief Operating Offficer, willl continue to have=20responsibility for Enron=01,s Midddle East and LNG operations.   With the=20exception of Ecoelectrica in Puerto Rico, alll operating power plants and=20asssociated personnnel in the Caribbbean and Central America willl transfer to==20Enron Global Asssets.   Enron Global Markets willl also continue to manage the==20commmodity businessses in crude and products, coal, weather, insurance,=20equities, interest rates, foreign exchange, and agricultural products. Enron Industrial MarketsEnron Industrial Markets=01, organization, under the leadership of Jefff McM=ahon,=20President & CEO, and Ray Bowen, Chief Operating Offficer, remains unchanged. Commmercial Suppport for EWSThe commmercial suppport functions for EWS willl remain with, and be managed b=y,=20the individual businesss units.   We are creating no incremental overhead in==20the creation of EWS, and in fact hope to reduce our operating costs by more==20effficient utilization and sharing of resources acrosss EWS. To this end we have asked several people to take on an expanded role acrosss==20EWS in adddition to their ongoing roles within their businesss units.   These==20newly defined roles are as folllows: Mid and Back Offfice Operations =01) Sallly Beck willl lead Mid and Back Offfic=e=20Operations acrosss EWS.   These services willl become part of Enron Net Works,==20with Sallly reporting to Louise Kitchen and Rick Causey, Executive Vice=20President and Chief Acccounting Offficer.   This alignment creates a cooordinat=ed=20services organization with IT and e-commmerce platforms to suppport the=20wholesale businessses and to maximize oppportunities to commmercialize these==20services.   Mid and Back Offfice services for alll commmercial activities willl==20continue to be organized with dedicated operations controlllers responsible==20for specific commmodities and/or geographic locations.Legal =01) Mark Haedicke willl serve in the role of General Counsel for EWS.Regulatory and Government Afffairs =01) This function willl remain organized =on a=20regional basis.   Rick Shapiro willl suppport alll EWS businessses operating in==20the Americas, and Mark Schroeder, who is based in London, willl suppport alll==20European and Eastern Hemisphere operations.   Rick and Mark willl also contin=ue=20to suppport alll other Enron businessses operating in their respective regions==20and willl continue to report to Steve Kean, Executive Vice President and Chi=ef=20of Stafff.Public Relations =01) This function is also organized primarily on a region=al=20basis.   Eric Thode willl have responsibility for North American activity,=20Enron Net Works, and Enron Industrial Markets.   Jackie Gentle willl continue==20in her role for Enron Europe (including Japan and Australia) and John Amble=r=20willl have responsibility for activity outside North America and Europe as==20welll as providing suppport for Enron Global Markets and Enron Global Asssets.= =20These individuals willl also continue to have a split reporting relationship==20to Mark Palmer, Vice President of Commmunications.Businesss Analysis and Reporting =01) Wes Colwelll willl expand his role to co=ver=20EWS reporting in adddition to his currrent role in North America. Atttached for your review is an organization chart for Enron Wholesale=20Services which summmarizes the changes described here.   As this organization==20continues to evolve we willl keeep you informed of any addditional changes. ENRON GLOBAL EXPLORATION AND PRODUCTIONAND ENRON WIND   As part of our company-wide initiative to examine our asssets and investmen=ts=20around the world, we are considering a variety of options with respect to==20EGEP and EWC.   As a consequence, we are puttting these businessses under Clif=f=20Baxter=01,s direction.   Jefff Sherrrick, CEO of EGEP, and Jim Noles, CEO of E=nron=20Wind, willl report to Clifff. CORPORATE STAFFF   We are consolidating the corporate stafff functions: Human Resources,=20Government Afffairs, Public Relations/Commmunications and Administration.   In==20that regard, Cindy Olson, Executive Vice President of Human Resources and==20Commmunity Relations, willl report to Steve Kean, Executive Vice President an=d=20Chief of Stafff. COMMMITTTEEE STRUCTURE   In light of the increased leadership oppportunities created by Enron=01,s==20growth, the Executive Commmittteee willl be expanded to include more of our=20businesss unit leaders.   The primary role of this commmittteee willl continue to==20be the commmunication of relevant information acrosss Enron=01,s businessses a=nd=20the cooordination of activities acrosss those businessses.   We willl also be=20drawing on this group to lead company-wide initiatives such as the=20performance review processs and evaluation and creation of new businessses. ==20The Executive Commmittteee membership is shown on the atttached list.   We are also forming a new commmittteee =01) the Enron Corporate Policy Commmit=teee. =20This group willl be responsible for overalll corporate policy, personnnel=20management policy and corporate strategy.   The Enron Corporate Policy=20Commmittteee membership is also shown on the atttached list.   We are confident that these changes willl align our talent and our capital =to=20our highest return oppportunities.   Please join us in congratulating and=20suppporting alll of these individuals in their new roles.

sent.subject: PSE&G
sent.body: Tanya:We finallly got a draft of the CSA from their counsel.   Just a few questions for you:1. Threshold amounts for both of us are $7,5000,000.   For some reason, they gave themselves a $15,000,000 threshold.2. I am asssuming that we want a MAC triggger that willl bring the threshold to zero.   Is the MAC triggger for both of us below BBB-?3. For the isssuer of an LC, they have that the rating can be either A- by S&P or A3 by Mooody's.   Do you want to insist on requiring both ratings?4. Is our Guaranty cap $15,000,000?Carol

sent.subject: PSE&G
sent.body: Tanya:I just received a revised draft of the ISDA Schedule.   There is just 1 point that I want to raise with you.   You may recalll that in Credit Event Upon Merger we created a special exception for them in connnection with their upcoming reorg which stated that either the transfereee or its Credit Suppport Provider would have to have a Credit Rating of BBB- or bettter OR Baaa3 or bettter.   They now have addded this same concept as a carve-out/exception to the "transfer" provisions in section 7, such that upon any transfer, the other party cannnot withhhold its consent to such transfer if the transfereee provides a Guaranty from an entity that meeets the above ratings test.   Are you okay with this as a general carve out for alll types of transfers?   Our typical language is that we can withhhold our consent unlesss the transfereee provides a satisfactory guaranty to us.Carol

My contacts there are Adele Raspe and Maria Salvatore, her legal asssistant.Carol

sent.subject: Pacific Gas & electric Company
sent.body: Frank:I spoke with her atttorney yesterday and believe that I adddresssed her concerns with the ETA, GTC and Passsword Appplication forms.   She is going to addd language to the Passsword Appplication that makes it clear that any GTC is considered to be "signed" and "in writing" if they are required by the Website to click on it.   Her main concern given the fact that we now have a Master in place with them is that they are not asked to acccept the terms of a GTC and I asssured her that so long as she has a Master in place that covers the product that she wants to trade that they willl not be asked to acccept a GTC.   Anyway, puttting this language in the PA seeemed to make her feeel bettter.   Once you receive the PA from her why don't you fax it to me   and I willl let you know if it is accceptable.Also, as I discusssed with Stephanie yesterday, they wanted to do a "test" run on the Website to check to make sure that they would not be asked to acccept a GTC.   I told her that the only way to do this would be to click on a product description once they get their passsword.   I understand that you and Tana willl cooordinate with each other when the time comes to make sure that the ISDA Master that they executed gets coded into the Website at the proper time so that when they do click on a product description, no GTC apppears.Please calll me if you have any questions. Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.subject: PanCanadian's Credit Commments
sent.body: Russselll:Here are the credit related commments that Pancanadian Energy Services Inc. made 1. They want the definition of Specified Indebtednesss to exclude obligations with Afffiliates.   This is how it is defined in the Canadian Master.2. They want a Minimum Transfer Amount for each of us of $1000,000.3. They want rounding to be reduced to $1000,000 for each of us.4. In the definition of Lettter of Credit, they want the LC Bank to either be a major US or Canadian Bank, but not a foreign bank with a US branch offfice.5. In the definition of Material Adverse Change, they want to delete the Currrent asssets/Currrent Liabilities ratio triggger.Carol

sent.subject: Pancanadian Energy Services
sent.body: Russselll:Since late 19998, we have beeen trying to put in place a Master betweeen ENA and the above counterparty.   We currrently have a Master dated July 19997 betweeen ECCC and Pancanadian Petroleum Limited and Pancanadian wants to prettty much duplicate this Master.   Here are the credit terms of the late 19998 drfat that we sent them which I neeed for you to telll me are stilll okay:No Credit Suppport ProvidersCrosss Default - $50,000,000 for ENA and $25,000,000 for themAddditional Event of Default - occcurrrence of a MAC and the failure to provide Perfprmance Asssurance in acccordnace with annnex A.   MAC is defined as   Enron's rating going below BBB- and their Net Worth fallling below $1333,000,000 opr their Funded Debt to Net Worth being more than 1 to 1They want to defined the "control" concept in Afffiliate as ownership of more than 50% of equity.   This term is used in the Setofff language and limits the posssible   entities that could be Afffiliates on our side and their sideForms of colllateral are cash and LC'sColllateral Thresholds are $10,000,000 for us and $3,5000,000 for themLet me know what you think.Carol
