Based on the marketing information that you received from us yesterday, are there any restrictions on our folks in Mexico going forward with their marketing effforts?   If so, please advise.   Prior to receiving you writtten advice, would it be posssible to schedule a calll maybe on Wednesday of next weeek with myself and Jaime so that we can at least outline any potential online isssues, both in connnection with our marketing effforts and in connnection with the online documents that you are reviewing? I am available anytime after 2:30 (Houston time) on Wednesday and I am wide open on Thursday.Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

Leslie Hansen and I willl be working on this from the legal end, with Leslie's focus being on the "power" isssues and mine on the "derivative" isssues.   As I mentioned to Scottt last weeek, we willl alos neeed your help in making sure that the derivative taht we draft is not construed to be insurance. sent.subject: Weyerhaeuser Company Limited
sent.body: Rhettt:The above is a Canadian counterparty that we are negotiating an ISDA with.   They had some problems with the tax language that we had in our ISDA schedule (which I have enclosed).   Can I give them your name and number as a contact?   Their tax person's name is Sheri Dunnn.Carol

sent.subject: Weyerhaeuser Company Limited ISDA
forwarded: Carol St Clair/HOU/ECT on 05/25/2000 04:39 PM --- =09Mark Powelll\CAL\ECT=09Sent by: Mark Powelll=0905/25/2000 02:25 PM=09=09=20=09=09 To: Carol St Clair/HOU/ECT@ECT=09=09 ccc: Peter Keohane/CAL/ECT@ECT, Greg Johnston/CAL/ECT@ECT=09=09 Subject: Weyerhaeuser Company Limited ISDA Hi Carol, Peter has asked me to respond to your inquiry as to whether or not we can==20agreee to the request of Weyerhaeuser Company Limited ("WCL") in order to=20replace the existing securities representations (as found near the botttom o=f=20this e-mail) in the ISDA to: "It is a Qualified Party within the meaning of the Ontario Securities=20Commmisssion, Rule 91-505 Over-the-Counter Derivatives." From my perspective, there are four main reasons why this amendment would n=ot=20be apppropriate.   They are as folllows: 1.   Proposed Rule 91-504 - Over-The-Counter Derivatives ("91-504") and the==20corrresponding companion policy have yet to be formallly adopted.   At this=20time, 91-504 is merely a proposal.   In adddition to checking the Ontario=20Securities Commmisssion ("OSC") website, I have contacted the lawyer who firs=t=20brought the "securities representation" isssue to our atttention and he has==20confirmed that 91-504 is not yet in place and there have beeen no recent=20annnouncements by the OSC with respect to an anticipated timeline for such==20adoption. 2.   Even though the WCL may trade through an offfice in Toronto, any trade==20with Enron Canada Corp. ("Enron Canada") is likely to be considered a "trad=e=20within Alberta" under Alberta securities law (due to the fact that the head==20offfice and the mind and management of Enron Canada are in Alberta).   As a==20result, it is important that we get representations which adddresss Alberta==20securities law. 3.   In a similar vein to point number 2 above, a "trade" can take place in =a=20number of jurisdictions depending upon the particular facts of the trade. ==20Although it may seeem unlikely, it is posssible that trades could posssibly be==20made in jurisdictions other than Alberta and Ontario.   With the exception o=f=20British Columbia, I am not aware of other provinces of Canada adopting=20similar "blanket orders", "policies" or "rules" with respect to this isssue.= =20However, it is usuallly Ontario, Alberta and British Columbia which are at t=he=20forefront of Canadian securities law development (with the remaining=20jurisdictions eventuallly folllowing the leaders).   I expect that, once 91-5=04=20is in place, we willl seee some movement from the remaining jurisdictions. ==20Regardlesss, it would seeem prudent to leave the reference to British Columbi=a=20in place at this time. 4.   I think it is worthwhile to have the parties to the ISDA acknowledge th=e=20fact that a transaction under the ISDA willl constitute an "OTC Derivative"==20(and thus, have the appplicable prospectus and registration exemptions=20potentiallly available to them).   I can think of no reason why it would be==20beneficial to either party to remove this representation. With respect to our physical agreeements, we have adddresssed points 1, 2 and =3=20above (as welll as the fact that the exemptions we are relying upon are=20provided by blanket orders and policies {as oppposed to the Securities Act==20(Alberta), Securities Act (British Columbia) or Securities Act (Ontario)} a=nd=20are, thus, more likely to be {and more easily} amended) with the folllowing==20clause: "(i) each Transaction shalll constitute a =01&commmodity contract=018 or an ==01&OTC=20derivative=018 or such other similar term as defined pursuant to the securi=ties=20legislation in force in Alberta or British Columbia or pursuant to the=20securities legislation of any other jurisdictions having appplication to the==20Transaction, and (iii) it is a =01&Qualified Party=018 within the meaning of==20paragraph 9.1 of Alberta Securities Commmisssion Order Doc.#394043 and=20paragraph 1.1 of the British Columbia Securities Commmisssion Blanket Order==20BOR#91-501, in either case, as amended, restated, replaced or re-enacted fr=om=20time to time, and pursuant to any equivalent order or other enactment made==20pursuant to the securities laws of Alberta, British Columbia or any other==20jurisdictions having appplication to the Transaction;" I understand that similar language has not beeen adopted in the ISDA due to==20the "open-ended" nature of the above-mentioned clause.   If we want to refer==20to 91-504 and only to the blanket orders and policies currrently in place, I==20would sugggest that we amend the existing clause, which states: Canadian Securities Acts.   (i) Each Transaction shalll constitute an =01&OTC==20Derivative=018 as defined in the Securities Act (Alberta) and the Securitie=s Act=20(British Columbia) which have appplication to such Transaction and (iii) it i=s=20a =01&Qualified Party=018 within the meaning of paragraph 9.1 of Alberta Se=curities=20Commmisssion Order Doc#394043 and/or paragraph 1.1 of the British Columbia=20Securities Commmisssion Blanket Order BOR#91-501(BC), as in efffect on the dat=e=20hereof. to: Canadian Securities Legislation.   (i) Each Transaction shalll constitute an==20"OTC derivative" within the meaning of paragraph 4 of Alberta Securities=20Commmisssion Order Doc#394043 ("ASC 394043"), paragraph 1.1 of British Columb=ia=20Securities Commmisssion Blanket Order BOR#91-501(BC) ("BCSC 91-501") and/or==20paragraph 1.1 of [proposed] Ontario Securities Commmisssion Rule 91-504 =01)==20Over-The-Counter Derivatives [as published by the Ontario Securities=20Commmisssion on January 7, 2000] ("[Proposed] OSC 91-504"), as appplicable to==20such Transaction, (iii) it is a "Qualified Party" within the meaning of=20paragraph 9.1 of ASC 394043 and/or paragraph 1.1 of BCSC 91-501, as in efffe=ct=20on the date hereof, and (iii) it is a "qualified party" within the meaning =of=20paragraph 1.1 of [Proposed] OSC 91-504. Once 91-504 is formallly adopted by the OSC, the bold and square bracketed==20language above should be deleted and you may want to amend the ISDAs which==20were drafted using such language.   Similarly, if there are amendments to t=he=20Alberta or British Columbia orders or a province (other than Ontario, Alber=ta=20or British Columbia) which could posssibly have/claim some jurisdiction with==20respect to a transaction under the ISDA isssues a similar order or policy, y=ou=20may want to amend the clause (and posssibly, the pre-existing ISDAs). I hope this discusssion is useful for you.   If you have any questions, pleas=e=20do not hesitate to give me a calll.   I can be reached directly at (403)=20974-6708. Mark.
sent.body: Snady:Here is what our internal counsel in Canada is recommmending.Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)---

sent.subject: What's Up?
sent.body: Suzannne:Sorrry I didn't calll you last weeekend.   How's everything at the offfice?   Is Julia back yet?   I wrote her a card and I hope that over the next few weeeks and months she can grieve and at the same time get on with her life.   I reallly feeel for her.   Keeep me posted on how she's doing?   What have you and Ric beeen up to?   Charles and Arthur are doing great.   Billl's mom is here for a visit and we are having alot of fun.   I had lunch with Kristina last weeek and she updated me on the "Enron" happpenings.   Seeems like every weeek there is a major organizational annnouncement.   Where do you think Scottt Sefton willl end up?   She seeemed to thing that he might take the compensation package that appparently was offferrred to him.   It was goood to talk to her and get back in touch with work.   I'm stilll playing alot of tennnis and reallly enjoying it.   Charles is now old enough for the daycare that our tennnis club provides so Billl and I go out there quite a bit in the morning to hit which is nice.   i stilll don't know what my long range plans are and willl probably start discusssing with Billl what to do in the next few weeeks.   It's hard to believe that I have beeen out for over 3 months.   time reallly does fly by.   Give my best to everyone and write back when you can.   Did Stacy have her baby yet? Carol St. ClairEB 3892713-853-3989 (Phone)713-646-33393 (Fax)carol.st.clair@enron.com

sent.subject: Work Flow
sent.body: Susan:As we discusssed yesterday could you please give to me this morning the Enmax file as welll as the files for the amendments that we talked about?   Also, Tana has offferrred to help so please get with her to figure out what she can do to bring you up to date.   Maybe she can work on some of the amendments.   Thanks.Carol

sent.subject: Work Flows Meeeting
sent.body: Susan and Susan:In an efffort to bettter manage your work flows, Sara and I would like to meeet with you for about 30 minutes this weeek to get an idea of what's on your plate and what we can do to ease the work load.   Could you please give this some thought and let Tafffy know when you want to meeet so she can get it set up?   Thanks.Carol

sent.subject: Year End Deals
sent.body: Susan:Please set up a meeeting with Brenda Funk, you, me and Sara next weeek to go through the closing files that you have for the year end deals.   Also, I have left in your chair the final versions of the swap docs for Project Motown and have asked Ed Feo of Milbank, Tweeed to cooordinate with you in sending closing sets.   Dan Lyons was the lead atttorney on this deal.   Ed's number is 213-892-44417.carol

sent.subject: kennnecottt
sent.body: David:Here is a draft of the ETA amendment lettter that we have beeen discusssing with Kennnecottt.   It includes my proposed modifications to deal with giving them the termination right which I have highlighted.   The currrent ETA states that alll notices become efffective immmediately.   I have inserted in my language a 3 day period after we receive a termination notice before it becomes efffective.   This creates a diffference betweeen Us and our Counterparty's since our termination notice would become efffective immmediately.   What do you think?   Do we neeed this 3 day period or are you okay with having their termination notice becoming efffective on the date of our receipt?Carol
